title: Data Analyst
description: Position Description<br><br><strong><u>Job Summary<br><br></u></strong>American Cancer Society (ACS) is seeking a passionate data individual on the fight against cancer. This position sits within the Digital Solution’s Discovery Data Science team, where we work with a wide range of data types.<br><br><strong><u>Major Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Design and execute measures, KPIs and descriptive analytic analysis by leveraging business acumen and analytic acumen.</li><li>Query, manipulate and validate data across multiple domains using database technologies and querying languages (SQL, Snowflake etc.)</li><li>You will partner with stakeholders providing analytical insights to drive strategic projects forward and perform ad hoc analyses on critical business issues.</li><li>Assist with PowerPoint presentations, reports consolidation and analysis reporting for our Extramural Discovery Science team.<br></li></ul>Position Requirements<br><br>FORMAL KNOWLEDGE<br><br>Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, Informatics, or equivalent experience. At least three years of relevant work experience.<br><br><strong><u>Skills<br><br></u></strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u><ul><li>Ability to extract and analyze large amounts of data using at least one data manipulation language required (SQL preferred.)</li><li>Design and execute measures, KPIs and descriptive analytic analysis by leveraging business acumen and analytic acumen.</li><li>Strong SQL and Excel skills.</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills; a team player who works well with functional and technical resources; aptitude for taking strategic direction from executive management and see tasks through to completion without significant guidance.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualification<br></u></strong><ul><li>Snowflake</li><li>Knowledge of grant data<br></li></ul>SPECIALIZED TRAINING OR KNOWLEDGE<br><br>Proven experience in data engineering for a modern data pipeline.<br><br>The starting rate is $75,000 t0 $80,000. The final candidate's relevant experience/skills will be considered before an offer is extended. Actual starting pay will vary based on non-discriminatory factors including, but not limited to, geographic location, experience, skills, specialty, and education.<br><br>The American Cancer Society has adopted a vaccination policy that requires all staff, regardless of position or work location, to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (except where prohibited by state law).<br><br>ACS provides staff a generous paid time off policy; medical, dental, retirement benefits, wellness programs, and professional development programs to enhance staff skills. Further details on our benefits can be found on our careers site at: jobs.cancer.org/benefits. We are a proud equal opportunity employer.<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer.<br><br>See our commitment to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity to continually ensure equal opportunity to our employees and to our applicants.

title: DATA ANALYTICS DEVELOPER
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong><strong> Old National Bank is honored to be named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the 11th consecutive year! <br><br></strong>Old National Bank was established in 1834. Today, we are the largest financial services holding company headquartered in Indiana. We provide an array of services to our clients which include Community Banking, Investments, and Wealth Management. At Old National, we believe that by helping our associates balance work life with home life, we create a more productive workforce and a stronger company.<br><br>We are currently seeking a Data Analytics Developer to join our growing Chief Data Office. They will report directly to the Analytics Manager. The ideal candidate has a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets across loan and deposit products, build consistent business user experience, and the business mindset to performed detailed analysis to produce business insights that will be used for our strategic opportunities. The Data Analytics Developer will work closely with leaders across Chief Data Office, Business Chief Information Officers, and Business Leads. They will ensure data accuracy and consistent reporting by designing and creating optimal analytics code with data controls defined as defined within the policy, procedure, and standards.<br><br><strong><u>Key Accountabilities<br><br></u></strong><strong> Develop and implement Power BI Reports: <br></strong><ul><li> Creates a consistent dashboard, reporting, and analytics experience for the business users </li><li> Understand business requirements of BI context and design a data model to transform raw data into meaningful insights </li><li> Convert business requirements into technical specifications and implement them through reports that support decision-making </li><li> Perform DAX queries and functions in Power BI <br></li></ul><strong><u>Develop Data Extracts<br></u></strong><ul><li> Ability to partner with business users to derive requirements, identify data sources, wrangle data and/or transform data via SQL and/or SAS to produce file extracts for use within PowerBI Dashboards or distribution to other systems </li><li> Creating customized diagrams and user-defined calculations as needed </li><li> Design, develop and deploy business intelligence solutions with SQL queries for best results, filters, and graphs to better understand your data at all levels for performance improvements and suggestions <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications And Education Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in related field; advanced coursework/training related to computer science, management information systems, and mathematics/statistics </li><li> 3+ years’ experience in banking and finance </li><li> 3+ years’ experience in developing analytics reports and dashboards, preferably PowerBI </li><li> 3+ years’ experience working with and creating data extracts </li><li> 3+ years’ experience programming skills with querying languages: SQL, SAS, etc. </li><li> 3+ years’ experience in Data visualization </li><li> Build, develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics support that support key business decisions. </li><li> Experience using analytics techniques to contribute to company growth efforts, increasing revenue and other key business outcomes. </li><li> Knowledge of industry leading practices in Analytics </li><li> Solid written, verbal, and interpersonal skills </li><li> Demonstrated ability to communicate and lead culture change initiatives </li><li> Strong banking domain expertise preferred </li><li> Strong project management skills <br></li></ul><strong> Old National is proud to be an equal opportunity employer focused on fostering an inclusive workplace and committed to hiring a workforce comprised of diverse backgrounds, cultures and thinking styles. <br><br></strong>As such, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>We do not accept resumes from external staffing agencies or independent recruiters for any of our openings unless we have an agreement signed by the Talent Acquisition Director, VP, to fill a specific position.

title: Data Engineer
description: At CLA we create inspired careers.<br><br>CLA, one of the nation’s largest public accounting and professional services firm is currently seeking a <strong>Data Engineer</strong> to join the growing Internal IT team.<br><br>The Senior Data Engineer leads collaboration with Data Engineers and other internal stakeholders to develop solutions that enable data, insights, analytics, and actionable triggers and solutions. You will utilizes a full range of data technologies to create new data patterns, establishing best practices and standards for managing large collections of data.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Job Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li> Pipeline Management: Designs and directs building of data pipelines, utilizing Azure Databricks and Azure Data Factory to build scalable solutions. Acts as point of escalation for Data Engineers to troubleshoot data-related problems. Authorizes maintenance, modifications and peer review as needed during the building process. Continually ensures successful operational monitoring and pipeline maintenance.</li><li> Data Solutions: Leads team of Data Engineers and other members of the Data Analytics team to analyze existing software programs and technology processes, ensuring continued effectiveness and efficiency. Acts as point of escalation for troubleshooting software problems. Leads team in gathering and analyzing data for business projects, as well as mapping underlying processes and data flows.</li><li> Design: Follows an existing framework to design and build various software systems at the request of other internal teams and on behalf of clients. Leads development of reports and data extraction as requested by other teams for use within the firm and on behalf of clients.</li><li>New Technology Implementation: Leads implementation of new technology for firm use, as well as creating roadmaps and tools to guide and monitor usage.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li> Minimum of 8 years total. At least 5 years of work experience in information technology with experience with data analytics tools and at least 3 years of hands on experience in design or development of enterprise data solutions, applications and integrations.<br></li></ul><strong>Education<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree or experience acceptable in lieu of bachelor’s degree.<br></li></ul>Equal Opportunity Employer /AA Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.<br><br>Click here to learn about your hiring rights.<br><br><strong>Wellness at CLA<br><br></strong>To support our CLA family members, we focus on their physical, financial, social, and emotional well-being and offer comprehensive benefit options that include health, dental, vision, 401k and much more.<br><br>To view a complete list of benefits click here.<br><br>

title: PowerApps Developer
description: <p>Title: Power Platform / Power Apps Specialist</p><p>Work location: Candidate must be able to work from Chicago, IL and Rosemont, IL</p><p>Type: Contract</p><p><br></p><p>JOB Description:</p><p>Power Platform / Power Apps Specialist</p><p><br></p><p>Qualifications</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are looking for a hands-on senior software engineer with deep knowledge of Microsoft Power Apps, including Microsoft Dynamics 365 developer</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An expert on Power Apps to design, configure and develop custom solutions in Microsoft Power platform</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The candidate should have excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills, attention to quality, self-motivation and a strong desire to succeed</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bachelor’s degree and 7+ years of experience</p><p><br></p><p>The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer</p><p>Selected candidate must be local and able to work from Chicago, IL and Rosemont, IL</p><p><br></p><p>Responsibilities:</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Serve as Microsoft Power Platform Subject Matter Expert (SME), with technical expertise including system architecture, solution design, system configuration, and security management</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The candidate will have excellent presentation, communication, leadership, and client development skills to effectively present information</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Drive Microsoft Power Platform implementations through all project phases including discovery, definition, build, test, and deploy</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Identify the client's sales, marketing, operations and customer service requirements through discovery meetings</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Help design the system architecture process, in partnership with the Development Team, to create, define specifications for and implement customizations for any custom code or data migration requirements using SQL Server Reporting Services</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conduct end-user training and create and maintain knowledge transfer documentation</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Develop and continue to refine Power Platform implementation standards and tools</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;COE (Center of Excellence)&nbsp;setup / governance requirement</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Present tailored demonstrations of the technology solution</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Responsible for high quality, bug-free development as per the coding standards in close collaboration and interaction with other members of the development/QA team</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participate in daily project scrum meetings and provide a daily personal status report</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Help create design documentation for new solutions and functions</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Work with the support team to resolve production support issues</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mentor the junior developers and help build the knowledge base</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Base knowledge of DevOps CI/CD tools and processes</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hands-on experience with SharePoint 2013 or newer to include both on-premise and SharePoint Online, SharePoint Designer to include creating custom workflow solutions, and PowerApps / Power Automate (M365 Suite of Products)</p><li><br></li>

title: Salesforce Developer
description: <p>Skills:</p> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience in Salesforce development.</li> <li>Experience in Apex, Visualforce, and Salesforce Lightning is a plus.</li> <li>Experience with integration using REST and SOAP APIs.</li> <li>Experience with Salesforce Community Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Service Cloud is preferred.</li> <li>Experience with Agile development methodologies.</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.</li> <li>Excellent communication and teamwork skills.</li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p>Responsibilities:</p> <ul> <li>Design and develop solutions within the Salesforce platform, including customizations, integrations, and enhancements to existing functionality, with a focus on delivering solutions for our business operations.</li> <li>Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements.</li> <li>Develop and maintain custom Visualforce pages, Apex classes, and triggers.</li> <li>Develop and maintain integrations between Salesforce and other systems, using REST and SOAP APIs.</li> <li>Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to support business processes.</li> <li>Participate in code reviews and ensure that all solutions are aligned with coding standards and best practices.</li> <li>Identify opportunities for process improvements and work with stakeholders to implement them.</li></ul>
description_json: <p>Skills:</p> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience in Salesforce development.</li> <li>Experience in Apex, Visualforce, and Salesforce Lightning is a plus.</li> <li>Experience with integration using REST and SOAP APIs.</li> <li>Experience with Salesforce Community Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Service Cloud is preferred.</li> <li>Experience with Agile development methodologies.</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.</li> <li>Excellent communication and teamwork skills.</li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p>Responsibilities:</p> <ul> <li>Design and develop solutions within the Salesforce platform, including customizations, integrations, and enhancements to existing functionality, with a focus on delivering solutions for our business operations.</li> <li>Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements.</li> <li>Develop and maintain custom Visualforce pages, Apex classes, and triggers.</li> <li>Develop and maintain integrations between Salesforce and other systems, using REST and SOAP APIs.</li> <li>Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to support business processes.</li> <li>Participate in code reviews and ensure that all solutions are aligned with coding standards and best practices.</li> <li>Identify opportunities for process improvements and work with stakeholders to implement them.</li></ul>

title: Entry Level Software Programmer (Remote)
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer (Oracle DBA) works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li><li>24x7 on-call rotation</li><li>Team player mentality working towards common goal</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Extensive experience with Oracle Database upgrades/patches/migrations with minimal downtime in a 24x7 environment.</li><li>Oracle Multitenant Container Database (CDB) and Pluggable Database (PDB) experience.</li><li>Oracle RAC experience</li><li>Advanced understanding of Oracle DataGuard/GoldenGate.</li><li>Knowledge of Oracle Exadata hardware.</li><li>Ability to manage high-severity critical incident issues and calls. You should be able to work on Root Cause Analysis and problem tickets, both pro-active and reactive.</li><li>DevOps/Agile environment, JIRA experience a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)
description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer (Oracle DBA) works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; You should be able to work on Root Cause Analysis and problem tickets, both pro-active and reactive.</li><li>DevOps/Agile environment, JIRA experience a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: The Enterprise Cloud Team is looking for a Cloud Engineer with hands-on Microsoft Azure cloud engineering experience and <strong>required Databricks infrastructure, performance, hands-on.</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Details</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is for USA Direct hire only Salary range from $90 K - $115 K</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The ideal candidate has experience working in hybrid (cloud &amp; on-prem) environments, and multi-cloud if possible, building and maintaining cloud group and subscription hierarchies, building and securing cloud-based infrastructure, supporting application runtime environments, architecting solutions and comfortable collaborating and communicating with engineers at all levels of the datacenter stack to implement complicated architectures and designs, while being hands-on as needed.</li><li>The ideal candidate must be a quick learner of our infrastructure/environment, proactive in taking on tasks and not afraid to assume ownership of the tasks, end-to-end.</li><li>The candidate must be a “do-er" not a follower and must be willing to provide commentary and opinion on just about any cloud-related topic.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage Databricks infrastructure and collaborate with various teams to ensure it integrates seamlessly with all components including network, security, messaging, and remote access. (REQUIRED)</li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve Databricks environment performance issues, connectivity issues, security issues. (REQUIRED)</li><li>Experience in setting up “Admin Group" and give user admin privileges, adding them to admins group using Admin Console, Groups API 2.0, SCIM API 2.0 or using SCIM-enabled identity provider. (REQUIRED)</li><li>Experience as “Databricks workspace Admin", who manage workspace users and groups including single sign-on, provisioning, access to Databricks SQL, and access control and workspace storage. (REQUIRED)</li><li>Work with Application and Solution Architects, Software Engineers &amp; Infrastructure Engineers to solve technical and operational challenges, drive efficiency and provide critical support for business impacting issues</li><li>Act as a point of escalation regarding Azure and AWS situations for the Cloud Support Team</li><li>Support multiple systems or applications of high complexity, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility</li><li>Act as the technical liaison between operational and development teams, providing critical operational insight to upcoming implementations and strategies, including validation of ongoing solutions supportability</li><li>Stay well-informed of failures and complications related to our cloud offerings</li><li>Be responsible for debugging technical issues inside a complex stack involving virtualization, containers, micro-services, etc.</li><li>Collaborate with engineering teams to enable their applications to migrate to and run on Cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Work with automation team to maintain Automation scripts / tools created to support monitoring and automation of operational support</li><li>Manage and Support cloud environments in accordance with company security guidelines.</li><li>Strong implementation and support of APIs to troubleshoot RESTful services and integration of them with consumers</li><li>Extensive experience with open-source technology, software development and system engineering.</li><li>Employ exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they snowball into problems.</li><li>Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud-based initiatives, providing associated training as required.</li><li>Lead and develop best practices and runbooks for use by operations and escalations teams</li><li>Stay current with industry trends, contributing to recommendations as needed to help the company excel.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering; Master's degree a plus.</li><li>Certification as an Azure Solutions Architect, Cloud Security Certification, and/or OpenStack</li><li>8+ years of experience in Azure cloud computing and design.</li><li>Experience with popular solutions from the leading cloud vendors, primarily Microsoft Azure, as well as Amazon Web Services (AWS)</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting micro-service and server-less design concepts and patterns</li><li>Proven design, planning and implementation experience with all infrastructure components including Storage, Network and Compute technologies</li><li>Experience working with Azure App Service, Azure Policy and Security Center - diagnosing and remediating resource contention issues and Identify failures in application logs</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining Azure Management Group hierarchies, Subscriptions, Resource Groups, employing out-of-the-box and custom Roles and Policies to support “minimal privileges" and “separation of responsibilities (SOR)"</li><li>Experience working with Agile methodologies supporting Infrastructure-as-a-service coding and deployment</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting Code/Devops and Data pipelines leveraging code repository tools such as GIT, CI/CD tools such as GitLab CI, image repositories such as Artifactory and Azure DevOps, Azure Data Flow pipelines</li><li>Hands-on experience with infrastructure and configuration management scripting tools and solutions - Hashicorp Terraform (required), Puppet, Chef, Ansible, CF templates, ARM</li><li>Experience implementing and supporting complex cloud security patterns, integrating on-premises and cloud security services, including encryption keys, certificates, PKI, CA, HSM's, key/secrets and Key Management Vault services</li><li>Coding and scripting experience using PowerShell, Python, Linux command-line shells such as Bash, korn, YAML and JSON, Cloud APIs, etc.</li><li>Comfortable coding in a polyglot environment, including Java, C/C++, NodeJS, Perl, Python, Scala, GoLang, .Net CORE</li><li>Experience implementing and maintaining complex authentication, authorization and single-sign-on (SSO) and federation patterns, leveraging SAML2, OAuth2/OIDC, IDaaS providers such as Okta, API Gateways, API orchestrations, and JWT's</li><li>Experience debugging complex API orchestrations, synchronous and asynchronous micro-service APIs using infrastructure and application logs</li><li>Excellent understanding of terminology and concepts across popular public cloud services, including the “cloud computing stack," i.e., Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS), as well as third-party services including Databricks, Snowflake, ElasticSearch</li><li>Understanding of artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), and experience working with Machine Learning services such as SparkML, pySpark, Scikit, Tensor, GPUs, etc.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Containerization technologies including Azure AKS, Redhat ARO/Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, EKS</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting data analytics platforms (including Data Lakes and Data Hubs) based on Hadoop/Hive/Spark family, Cloudera, HortonWorks, SnowFlake</li><li>Experience implementing, securing, and supporting SQL, NoSQL and document databases, including complex queries, PL/SQL</li><li>Experience with implementing and automating on-premise private cloud technologies such as OpenShift, Pivotal and custom Automation tooling</li><li>Ability to interface with and communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.</li><li>Self-motivated and skilled at working in tandem with a team of engineers, or alone as required.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills to assist clients both internal and external and the ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals within a busy workspace.</li><li>Time management skills with the ability to manage multiple work streams and lead and mentor less experienced engineers-Strong awareness of networking and internet protocols, including TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP and distributed networks.</li><li>Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues with a variety of cloud vendors and services using cloud infrastructure and application logs</li><li>Experience with operating systems such as Linux, Unix &amp; Windows</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About NPO USA</u></strong><p><br></p>If you are smart and curious about new things, we are looking for you: this is an exciting opportunity to work, learn and acquire new skills!

title: Azure Infrastructure Engineer -Remote
description: <strong>Department: </strong>Univ Athletics-Football<p><br></p><strong>Salary/Grade: </strong>EXS/5<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Quality Control Analyst assists with game preparation and management as well as recruiting for the football program.<p><br></p>*Willingness and ability to travel as well as work evenings, weekends and holidays.*<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong>  <ul><li> Assists coaches and staff with: 80%</li><ul><li> Creating and preparing playbooks, depth charts, practice and game plans, scouting and tendency reports and practice cards; </li><li> Data entry and research; </li><li> Charting duties during practice and on gameday </li><li> Weekly and post season self scout analysis </li></ul><li> Assists the Director of Player Personnel and coaches with: 15%</li><ul><li> Updating and managing the recruiting database </li><li> Organizing recruiting areas </li><li> Completing required compliance and business office paperwork as it relates to recruiting (official and unofficial visits, camps/clinics, etc.); </li><li> Tracking recruiting activity; </li><li> Creating material for social media platforms </li><li> Coordinating recruit visits and tickets </li></ul><li> Responsible for adhering to all Department and University policies and procedures, as well as the rules, regulations, bylaws and interpretations of the Big Ten Conference and the NCAA. </li><li> Other duties as assigned or required. 5% </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree; OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> Possess ability to communicate effectively one-to-one, in small groups and in public speaking contexts; writes precise, well-organized emails, letters and proposals while using appropriate vocabulary and grammar. </li><li> Team player </li><li> Strong analytical skills </li><li> Extensive knowledge of football technology, including Visio. </li><li> Experience working with a Division I or professional football team is preferred. </li><li> Knowledge of rules and regulations of the NCAA is required, while knowledge of the Big Ten Conference and Northwestern University preferred. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more.<p><br></p><strong><u>Work-Life And Wellness</u></strong><p><br></p>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<p><br></p>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. <strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.<br><br></em>

Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. <strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.<br><br></em>

title: Quality Control Analyst
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The Senior Business Systems Analyst works under the Business Systems Manager to support all aspects of our business systems. Works with user groups, functional managers, development teams, and project and IT teams to identify process enhancements and systems design opportunities, and to improve the efficiency of the systems. Solves organizational process problems by analyzing requirements and recommending system changes and procedures. Responsibilities " Analyze current business processes and make recommendations for improvement based on industry trends and professional business knowledge. " Improve training and operational procedures within a business to increase efficiency and productivity " Work directly with clients to understand the individual needs of the business. " Create and present reports to executive team member to support recommendations. " Oversee implementation projects from beginnings to completion. " Use a variety of data analysis and organization tools to Client the most impactful insights. " Define project requirements by identifying project milestones. " Work with all the areas of the business including production, supply chain, Quality, Purchasing, Finance, and third-party systems which are interfaced with SAP systems. " Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, and recommending change. " Provide routine production support through business and system solutions. " Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users. " Maintain system protocols by writing and updating procedures " Consult with department managers to develop system solutions consistent with organizational objectives. " Monitor overall Business System effectiveness and recommends potential improvements. " Potential travel to support multiple facilities. " Ability to lead business users / stakeholders and IT team members to complete assigned workstream tasks in a timely manner and with expected level of quality. Requirements " Bachelor's degree and 3+ years of related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. " 6+ years of SAP implementation and/or operation and maintenance experience across the following Batch Management, Demand Planning, MRP, Production Planning Detailed Scheduling (PP-DS), Production Execution (PP-PI), Quality Management, Purchasing, Manufacturing execution systems (MES), Plant Maintenance, Inventory Management (EWM) " Experience in GxP environments and relevant testing requirements " Experience in computer system validation, authoring CSV deliverables, execution of testing, resolving of defects. " 5+ years manufacturing industry experience is required. Pharmaceutical industry is preferred.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Business systems analysis, Business analysis, sap, sap pp-pi, sap ewm, toc, erpss<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>Business systems analysis,Business analysis,sap,sap pp-pi,sap ewm,toc,erpss<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>SAP PPM Healthcare of pharma preferred EWM warehouse/inventory management<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>Intermediate Level<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US. At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances, be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

title: SR BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST (SAP)
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Position Overview<br><br></strong>As an EHSQ Systems Analyst, you will be focused on users and the administration of their data through Intelex, Invenergy’s compliance management and EHSQ software system. You will be focusing on coordinating the training tracking between the Learning Management System, LMS, and maintaining the records in Intelex. You will be working with the Training Team to align courses and qualifications between the systems. The Systems Analyst will conduct data entry, data analysis, and create training reports as needed. You will manage the administration of, and track the completion of, onboarding plans, new hires, and qualification assignments.<br><br>Additionally, in coordination with the EHS department, the EHSQ Systems Analyst will review safety records and data to identify opportunities to improve overall fleet safety practices and optimize data gathering processes. Invenergy wants a team player willing to use their analytical, conceptual, and creative thinking skills to manage and monitor database information and functionality as well as look for ways to improve system efficiency and reliability.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Coordination with training personnel on developing, optimizing, and maintaining the fleet’s training records</li><li>Manage Training Tracking, Maintain Training Records and Documentation according to applicable internal and external requirements. (LMS)</li><li>Acts as an internal consultant and trusted advisor with the training team and with cross functional partners on the LMS</li><li>Perform data entry to record, plan and schedule training using the LMS</li><li>Update LMS as needed including assigning curriculum, adding, and deleting new courses, etc.</li><li>Respond to requests from various EHSQ database users throughout the fleet using established practices and policies</li><li>Perform data analysis for data integrity, accuracy, and error correction</li><li>Build reports to extract data sets for analysis</li><li>Provide support for day-to-day needs of the operational fleet</li><li>Onboard new employees and update existing employees in the EHSQ system, in coordination with IT department personnel</li><li>Coordination with Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) personnel on developing, optimizing, and maintaining best practices within the system and throughout the fleet</li><li>Develop training materials and conduct remote training from the Chicago office</li><li>Import new data for various parties to use within EHSQ database</li><li>Populate new operating site information, including new role assignments and updating reporting structures</li><li>Coordinate task management within EHSQ database<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science, occupational safety, educational technology or related field</li><li>Previous experience conducting group training and ability to speak in front of small groups or through web-conferencing to larger groups</li><li>Ability to work effectively with all levels of personnel and to work under minimal supervision</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Proficiency with Microsoft Office software (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)</li><li>Troubleshooting and coordination skills<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience with an EHSQ platform (Intelex) or XML based coding</li><li>Previous experience writing reports and developing KPIs</li><li>Exposure to Python and SQL</li><li>Bilingual (Spanish)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), profit sharing, bonus, paid time off, etc.<br><br>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

description: <ul><li>Logistics*</li><li>Hybrid - 2 days remote 3 days in office after training</li><li>During training the schedule will be in the office 5 days/week</li><li>Hours can be 7-3:30, 8-4:30, or 8:30-5</li><li>Responsibilities*</li><li>Perform quality reviews across key credit processes focusing primarily on credit proposals</li><li>Analyze facility set ups in iCRD to ensure they align with the data found in the supporting documentation</li><li>Build expertise over time and be able to apply foundational principles to additionaldisciplines</li><li>Ensure proper controls are in place and updated accordingly to minimize operating risk</li><li>Ensure organizational requests, queries, and issues sent to the team are actioned accurately and timely</li><li>Manage and monitor production queues, exception reporting, and KPI’s</li><li>Engage technology partners to help drive database functionality or stability improvements</li><li>Build effective relationships with Operations, Credit, Control, and Technology</li><li>Prepare ad hoc reports for the control organization, audit, or business partners when requested</li><li>Research, analyze and assimilate data as required for various projects</li><li>Assist with the implementation of CORE</li><li>Participate in discussion aimed at improving the overall quality environment within WLS</li><li>Participate in internal working groups as required representing the QC team</li><li>Actively participate in organizational initiatives working with other team members</li><li>Ability to quickly interpret credit approval requirements in relation to Risk Policies and consistently apply the requirements within daily activities</li><li>Qualifications*</li><li>Bachelor’s degree with 1-3 years of financial services, audit, accounting control, regulatory, compliance, or equivalent experience is preferred</li><li>Financial services industry knowledge with regulatory practices, including lending, loan processing, and support operations</li><li>Demonstrated decision-making skills</li><li>Working knowledge of credit products such as revolving lines of credit, term loans, commercial cards, letters of credit</li><li>Accurate and attentive to detail<br><br></li></ul>About Aston Carter:<br><br>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. title: Quality Control Analyst
description: CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for an Applications Developer based in our Chicago, IL office. Take a look at the description below. If you think your skills and experience make you a good match for this position, we’d love to hear from you. We’re looking for creative, curious, empathetic people to join our Living-Centered Design movement.<br><br><strong>About Our Firm<br><br></strong>CannonDesign is an integrated design solutions firm focused on helping people continuously flourish. Whether designing for innovations in health, new scientific discoveries, equity in education or the next big idea in business, we use our Living-Centered Design approach to help organizations realize widespread change. Our ability to design transformational places, plans and strategies is why Fast Company named us a World Changing Company and one of the most innovative design firms in the world.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>As a member of the Technology team, you will collaborate with your colleagues to create sustainable, scalable applications. Working in the Microsoft stack using .NET Core, Entity Framework, Azure DevOps and similar, you will take applications from conceptualization to deployment and continue to support them thereafter. You will be working alongside – and mentored by – senior developers and given all tools and opportunities necessary for personal growth.<br><br><strong>What You Will Do<br><br></strong><ul><li>Review of projects with managers to ensure quality, efficient and profitable project performance, and implementation. </li><li>Collaborate with Project/Product management, Designers, and Engineers in an agile environment. </li><li>Conduct code reviews with programming peers. </li><li>Keep up with evolving tech trends and best practices. </li><li>Analyze end-user needs and design, test, and develop software to satisfy demand. </li><li>Other duties as assigned. <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Your Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science, or related field preferred. </li><li>Minimum of 4 years’ experience in web and/or mobile application development</li><li>Must be able to demonstrate history of successful project delivery. </li><li>Familiarity with Agile development methodology. </li><li>Experience with C#, .NET Framework, and Entity Framework. </li><li>Experience with MSSQL. </li><li>Experience with developing REST APIs. </li><li>Experience with Azure and Azure DevOps. </li><li>Experience using HTML and CSS. </li><li>Experience using Git. <br><br></li></ul>As a Federal Contractor, CannonDesign is required to comply with President Biden's Executive Order 14042. Therefore, as a condition of employment, all employees must provide proof of receipt of a full COVID-19 vaccination unless qualified for a valid medical or religious accommodation.<br><br><strong>About Working Here<br><br></strong><ul><li>We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about. </li><li>We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our DEI Council, Employee Resource Groups and other community advocacy initiatives. </li><li>We’re about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we’re ready for you. <br><br></li></ul>For a general overview of our benefits, please visit our careers page at www.cannondesign.com/careers/<br><br><em>Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.<br><br></em>As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.<br><br>CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at CannonDesign in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship/alienage.

You will be working alongside – and mentored by – senior developers and given all tools and opportunities necessary for personal growth.<br><br><strong>What You Will Do<br><br></strong><ul><li>Review of projects with managers to ensure quality, efficient and profitable project performance, and implementation. </li><li>Collaborate with Project/Product management, Designers, and Engineers in an agile environment. </li><li>Conduct code reviews with programming peers. </li><li>Keep up with evolving tech trends and best practices. </li><li>Analyze end-user needs and design, test, and develop software to satisfy demand. </li><li>Other duties as assigned. <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Your Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science, or related field preferred. </li><li>Minimum of 4 years’ experience in web and/or mobile application development</li><li>Must be able to demonstrate history of successful project delivery. </li><li>Familiarity with Agile development methodology. </li><li>Experience with C#, .NET Framework, and Entity Framework. </li><li>Experience with MSSQL. </li><li>Experience with developing REST APIs. </li><li>Experience with Azure and Azure DevOps. </li><li>Experience using HTML and CSS. </li><li>Experience using Git. <br><br></li></ul>As a Federal Contractor, CannonDesign is required to comply with President Biden's Executive Order 14042. Therefore, as a condition of employment, all employees must provide proof of receipt of a full COVID-19 vaccination unless qualified for a valid medical or religious accommodation.<br><br><strong>About Working Here<br><br></strong><ul><li>We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about. </li><li>We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our DEI Council, Employee Resource Groups and other community advocacy initiatives. </li><li>We’re about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we’re ready for you. <br><br></li></ul>For a general overview of our benefits, please visit our careers page at www.cannondesign.com/careers/<br><br><em>Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.<br><br></em>As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.<br><br>CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at CannonDesign in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship/alienage.

title: Applications Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Adobe Implementation Specialist, you will be part of DNA Marketing Technology team, serving teams that engage with customers and prospects throughout the customer journey, from acquisition marketing to portfolio collections to digital app experience across Discover. You will work with DNA Martech Engineers, Data collections product owners, Business stakeholders and Data Scientists to design, develop and implement technical tagging requirements for company web and mobile app platforms.<p><br></p>You will lead the design and implementation of MarTech solutions with a focus on Adobe Analytics, Adobe Launch and AEP. You will be a liaison between the Adobe Analytics analysts, launch implementation developers, and data layer developers, owning projects to ensure tagging is complete and accurate. You will have the opportunity to work on solutions that drive business value for improved analysis, storytelling, and customer journey development.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and leads an Agile team focused on next-generation data and analytic technologies.</li><li>Provides technical consulting in support of the creation and enhancement of analytical platforms and tools.</li><li>Provides technical consulting to application development teams during application design and development for highly complex and critical data projects.</li><li>Partners on a team to deliver data projects, including migration to new data technologies for unstructured, streaming, and high-volume data.</li><li>Develops and deploys big data applications.</li><li>Builds and administers large scale data platforms. Integrates next-generation data analytic tools into the big data ecosystem.</li><li>Responsible for architecting, configuring, and administering an analytics infrastructure in partnership with Product, Design, and IT Development.</li><li>Debugs/troubleshoots/resolves Adobe configuration and integration issues.</li><li>Assess, audit and identify gaps in existing tagging, infrastructure and Adobe Launch configurations.</li><li>Develops and document Discover MarTech’s data collection standards and best practices.</li><li>Support implementation architecture strategy and governance</li><li>Develops instrumentation strategies across multiple websites &amp; mobile apps.</li><li>Provides guidance and mentorship to the development team to ensure high-quality code and adherence to coding standards.<br><br></li></ul><ul><li>Responsible for the following tasks:</li><ul><li>Tagging for both websites &amp; native mobile apps in enterprise-grade environments</li><li>Tagging schemas and specifications for new sites and new site features</li><li>Quality Assurance and debugging of tagging as implemented by engineers.</li><li>Data layer design and implementation</li><li>Writing tagging specifications for engineers.<br><br></li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related field</li><li>2+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years’ Experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field, with 4+ years on Adobe Analytics</li><li>Strong knowledge of tag management data collection platforms such as Adobe Launch, GTM etc.</li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the Adobe ecosystem, including Adobe Experience platform, Adobe Launch, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and Adobe Mobile SDK.</li><li>Must have hands-on experience in creating Analytics solutions design, implementation, and integrations.</li><li>Expert in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML</li><li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript and common libraries used in website building (e. g. jQquery, React).</li><li>Knowledge of considerations of analytics code and 3rd parties SDKs implementation in native mobile apps.</li><li>Be able to create SDR and convert it to exact script code to be added on page/app screens or user actions on page.</li><li>Experience with Real Time CDP Connections integration with AdTech products.</li><li>Knowledge of single page applications web analytics data collection integrations</li><li>Have solid analytics implementation experience across the life cycle and digital platforms (including web, responsive and native mobile apps) using Adobe/Google Analytics especially for complex eco-systems (multiple sites/apps, 100s of custom tags, multiple implementation techniques for main site/syndicate sites etc.)</li><li>Adobe Analytics Architect Master certificate.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Adobe Implementation Specialist
description: <p>Hi Professionals,</p> <p> </p> <p>Greetings from <strong>All IT Solutions LLC </strong>Please go through the job description and let me know if you are interested</p> <p> </p> <p><strong>IAM Engineer</strong></p> <p><strong>Location Chicago IL</strong></p> <p><strong>Mode: Hybrid (twice a week)</strong></p> <p><strong>Work Authorization: H1B , GC, GC EAD USC OR TN VISA</strong></p> <p><strong>Minimum experience Required : 9 years</strong><strong> </strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Job Description</strong></p> <p>Job Description: Seeking a contractor who has extensive and practical experience with Security Products, Protocols, authentication, directory services, federation, identity management, and MFA. Candidate should have experience in the maintenance and testing of software programs and solutions supporting the Information Security program.</p> <p> </p> <p>Contractor's Role:</p> <p>The ideal candidate is passionate about security, has experience building large scale enterprise software, and has direct experience in SSO, Multifactor authentication, identity, and security.</p> <p> </p> <p>Experience Level: Senior</p> <p> </p> <p>Qualifications:</p> <p>• <strong>Minimum 9 years of IT experience with at least 5 of those years focused on Information Technology -Security</strong> • <strong>Strong knowledge of information security and IAM principles and practices </strong>• <strong>Advanced knowledge with a wide range of IAM technologies including, but not limited to the Ping Identity Suite, Oracle Access Manager (OAM11g), Okta, Cloud Technologies including Azure AD, Amazon Web Services</strong>, • <strong>Knowledge on Programming languages such as Java/Java Script, REST/SOAP API development, Oracle and/or SQL Server; Virtual Directory Services.</strong></p> <p>• I<strong>n depth knowledge on security standards and identity protocols (SAML, WS-Federation, WS-Trust, and OAuth/OpenID Connect).</strong></p> <p>• Good understanding of Cloud implementation and their security points • Strong technical expertise in Deploying, Configuring and Upgrading PingFederate.</p> <p>•<strong> Experience in Migration strategy and implementation from Oracle Access Manager to PingIdentity / Okta.</strong></p> <p>• Must have working knowledge of Custom development using PingFederate/PingAccess.</p> <p>• Experience with Linux operating systems and application servers.</p> <p>• Ability to lead complex projects</p> <p>• Capable of working on multiple projects simultaneously • Excellent communication skills with ability to communicate clearly with peers, managers and clients.</p> <p>• Experience of developing and leading innovative solutions and "thinking outside of the box".</p> <p> </p> <p>Tasks &amp; Responsibilities:</p> <p>• Deploying, Configuring and security uses cases including setting up SSO Connections with Third party applications.</p> <p>• Design, develop and implement Single Sign-On solutions for externally hosted vendor (3rd party) applications using SAML and OAuth (specifically on AzureAD) • Experience in Working on different types of authorization grants (client credentials, ROPC and authorization code), adapters (WAM, Reference token, Html Form Idp, Kerberos) .</p> <p>• Work on OAuth Access token management, Access token mapping, OpenID connect policy management in AzureAD.</p> <p>• Develop Two-factor authentications like RSA and Symantec soft token for the software applications.</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks &amp; Regards,</p> <p>Santhosh Kumar </p> <p>Recruitment Head</p> <p>All IT Solutions LLC</p> <p>+1 609-299-1515 | 609-683-3675 | santosh@allitsolutions.us</p> <p><u>http://</u>www.<u>allitsolutions.us</u></p> <p>https://www.indeed.com/cmp/All-IT-Solutions-LLC</p> <p>https://www.linkedin.com/company/all-it-solutionsus/ </p>

Regards,</p> <p>Santhosh Kumar </p> <p>Recruitment Head</p> <p>All IT Solutions LLC</p> <p>+1 609-299-1515 | 609-683-3675 | santosh@allitsolutions.us</p> <p><u>http://</u>www.<u>allitsolutions.us</u></p> <p>https://www.indeed.com/cmp/All-IT-Solutions-LLC</p> <p>https://www.linkedin.com/company/all-it-solutionsus/ </p>

title: System Software Engineer
description: As the largest life insurance premium finance company in the country, Wintrust Life Finance provides customized financing solutions to qualified borrowers seeking to finance their life insurance premiums. Our financing solutions have supported numerous planning structures, including traditional wealth transfer, key-man insurance, buy-sell arrangements, split dollar arrangements, term alternatives, charitable giving, income replacement strategies, and more. Wintrust Life Finance is a subsidiary of Wintrust, a financial services company with more than $50 billion in assets.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>An award-winning culture! We are rated a Top Workplace by the Chicago Tribune (past 8 years) and Employee Recommended award by the Globe &amp; Mail (past 6 years)</li><li>Competitive pay </li><li>Comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, vision, life, a 401k plan with a generous company match and tuition reimbursement to name a few</li><li>Family-friendly work hours</li><li>With 175+ community bank locations, we offer opportunities to grow and develop in your career</li><li>Promote from within </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why join this team?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We work in a dynamic environment that promotes creativity and problem-solving </li><li>Teamwork and collaboration are a critical aspect of the quality control environment </li><li>Ability to manage multiple tasks and meeting deadlines</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Performs post booking review and verification of the loan system data for new business and renewals, against the documentation and credit approval. </li><li>Reviews loan maintenance entered for all life loans by loan analyst and/or loan officers.</li><li>Verifies maintenance affecting a loan processed by someone outside of Loan Operations. </li><li>Documents, communicates and follows-up on loan corrections needed as result of the quality control process. Provides reporting on QC items.</li><li>Maintains timely follow up and daily productivity of assigned workload.</li><li>Assist department with special tasks and roll out of new projects.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 2 years of experience within a quality control role in the banking/financial services industry. (Required)</li><li>Requires working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication</li><li>Ability to effectively communicate with all levels within the organization</li><li>Strong attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to work with others, willingness to learn new concepts, adaptable to frequent change and strong sense of ownership</li><li>Bachelor’s degree preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>#LI -HYBRID<p><br></p>From our first day in business, Wintrust has been proud to serve a variety of unique communities and people from all walks of life. To be Chicago’s Bank® and Wisconsin's Bank®, we need to reflect that diversity both in all the communities we serve, the people we employ, the organizations we work with, and our banking and lending practices. Wintrust Financial Corporation, including community banking and financial services subsidiaries, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Quality Control Specialist
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Global Firm is currently seeking a Kafka Cloud Engineer. Candidate will perform a range of activities required to both maintain and continuously automate a large, complex virtualization and cloud-based computing environment. In addition, you will provide technical guidance within the team on kafka and when called upon, serve as a technical liaison between internal departments. This will involve utilizing best practices for the management, architecture, configuration, DR, administration, and automation of the enterprise server virtualization environment with cloud technologies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide professional input to the organization for cloud and virtualization end-to-end architecture and IaaS, as well as PaaS and SaaS solutions such as AWS RedShift</li><li>Develop and maintain a library of deployable, tested, and documented automation design scripts, processes, and procedures</li><li>Enable DevOps development activities and complex development tasks that will involve working with tools such as Docker, Kafka and container management systems</li><li>Provide advanced Kafka administrative support</li><li>Design, configure, implement and support an automated workflow for cloud and virtual environment provisioning, with a particular focus on Kafka clusters.</li><li>Implement production changes during defined maintenance windows and support on call rotation</li><li>Perform cloud computing and virtual environment build-outs, software installation, maintenance and support</li><li>Write and maintain documentation of relevant operating procedures and processes</li><li>Design, develop, and build the business's cloud infrastructure architecture</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong experience with Confluent's Kafka Products and Platforms</li><li>[Working knowledge of infrastructure design and components, such as: Servers, operating systems, networks, and storage (basic) and (advanced) knowledge of Confluent Kafka.</li><li>Experience with architecting, implementing and maintaining highly available mission critical environments for 24/7 availability</li><li>Experience working in an environment with a defined production change control process</li><li>[Demonstrates history of working within deadlines and ability to work well under pressure</li><li>Strong hands-on experience Scripting/development skills in Python, Ruby, Go, Java, JavaScript, etc. in a corporate environment </li><li>Hands-on experience with: Terraform, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Kafka, Github, OpenShift, and configuration management tools such as Ansible.</li><li>Relevant experience with configuration and implementation of IaaS, Infrastructure as code, AWS.</li><li>AWS Solutions Architect Associate Certification or higher strongly desired</li><li>Relevant industry certifications such as Confluent Certified Administrator for Apache Kafka</li><li>Certificates or Licenses:</li><li>Bachelor's degree, preferably in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.), or equivalent combination of education and experience required</li><li>3+ years experience in IT systems installation, operations, administration, and maintenance of virtualized Servers/cloud systems and Kafka systems.</li></ul>
