title: Application Engineer
description: <strong>Job#: 1345640<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description:<br><br></strong>If you would like to be considered for this position please send your most updated resume to cmsnyder@apexsystems.com.<br><br><strong>Monitoring SME<br><br></strong><strong>Must be Local to Rhode Island<br><br></strong><strong>Position Summary<br><br></strong>The SRE Monitoring SME is responsible for supporting the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), Retail Technology team in assessment of monitoring gaps, instrument monitoring assets. Leverage existing monitoring products to deliver reliable and resilient monitoring eco-system. This individual will work closely with application, incident management and infrastructure teams to execute and deliver best practices of SRE. Ideal candidate will have engineering experience and drive to improve existing systems and processes, with creativity to develop innovative solutions to evolving challenges. Goal to improve availability and reliability of critical platform services and applications, ensuring they meet the requirements of internal and external users. Understand production support &amp; incident management processes. Need ability to provide guidance to improve MTTR and MTBF for critical platforms. Ability to multi-task and manage to aggressive deliverable dates is a must.<br><br><strong>Required Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li> Overall 8+ years of professional IT experience</li><li> 5 years+ experience in leading implantation of Site Reliability Engineering for large and critical systems</li><li> 3 years+ experience in working with APM tools such as App Dynamics and SPLUNK.</li><li> AppDynamics certified implementation professional certification.</li><li> Splunk Core Certified User certification</li><li></li><li> Strong foundation and expert knowledge in Core Java and J2EE standards.</li><li> Fluency in programming constructs and working with Spring and Hibernate framework.</li><li> Understanding of healthcare business is preferred but not required</li><li> The ability to multi-task and work multiple projects concurrently managing to aggressive deliverable dates.</li><li> Build software and systems to manage platform infrastructure and applications</li><li> Improve reliability, quality, and time-to-market of our suite of software solutions</li><li> Create sustainable systems and services through automation and uplifts</li><li> Balance feature development speed and reliability with well-defined service-level objectives</li><li> Worked in traditional Infrastructure as well as Cloud based deployment environments</li><li> Works with a sense of urgency in completing tasks and resolving issues to deliver a quality on time and within budget projects.</li><li> Strong written and verbal communication skills</li><li> Comfortable interacting with business stakeholders and external clients Required Technical Skill</li><li> Extensive hands-on experience in instrumenting and implementing Business relevant monitoring leveraging AppDynamics, Splunk and other APM technologies</li><li></li><li> Experience with Java frameworks such as Spring IoC, Spring MVC, Struts, Hibernate, Spring JDBC.</li><li> Hands-on experience in developing and deploying enterprise applications J2EE middleware stack</li><li> Participate in system design consulting, platform management, and capacity planning</li><li> Strong analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li> Provide support activities post code deployment as required from business</li><li></li><li> Database knowledge – SQL, table structure, data relationships</li><li> Experience with scripting languages Java, Python, R is a big plus</li><li> Associate Performance Analyst and Associate Administrator certifications for AppDynamics(Preferred).<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com or 844-463-6178.<br><br>4400 Cox Road<br><br>Suite 200<br><br>Glen Allen, Virginia 23060<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com (Do not submit resumes or solicit consultants to this email address). title: Vehicle Embedded Systems Engineer
description: NO SPONSORSHIP<p><br></p><ul><li>Will initially be remote then after 6 months to one year the role will be on site in Chicago 2 days a week.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Contract to Hire - Quality Assurance Engineer</strong><p><br></p>Must be vaccinated<p><br></p>LOCATION: Chicago, IL<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will be local and open to contract-to-hire<p><br></p>Duration: minimum 6 months to 1 year to 1.5 years then direct hire<p><br></p>2 days on site, 3 days remote<p><br></p>SELLING POINTS: remote but will consider candidates that will move down the road. C# full stack web applications UI usability manual and automation selenium test mobile and API strong plus Agile Waterfall methodologies code reviews<p><br></p>The Test Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of new features as well as improvement of existing functionality across internal and external Web applications. This includes Integration testing, Customer Data Quality testing, Usability (Functional and Performance) testing, Regression testing etc.<p><br></p>This is a hands-on testing position which requires deep knowledge and understanding of all aspects of developing and executing Front End as well as Back End testing. The Test Engineer must be an advocate for all things Testing and Quality Assurance while driving and implementing best practices. The ideal candidate must possess strong analytical and critical thinking abilities.<p><br></p>Manual testing as well as Automated testing skills are required<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related area.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Planning and Manual test execution.</li><li>Experience in Regression Test Strategies, Regression suite maintenance and execution.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Automated Testing tools such as Selenium, TestComplete, UFT etc </li><li>Hands-on experience using SQL queries for results validation and data mining.</li><li>At least 3-5 years of professional experience on a variety of projects in Test Strategy, Test Design, Test Execution analysis &amp; reporting.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Jira, ALM, TFS/ADO or similar systems of record.</li><li>Understanding of Development and Test cycles, including respective best practices.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies. </li><li>Ability to troubleshoot issues, identifying root causes and support development team in development of resolutions.</li><li>Experience in Mobile and API testing is a strong plus.</li><li>Strong communication and Client/Business interfacing and interpersonal skills are a must.</li><li> Experience developing and maintaining a C# Test automation framework. </li><li>Experience developing and maintaining a Selenium test framework that integrates with C#.</li></ul>

title: Kafka Cloud Engineer

description: <p><strong>Role: Servicenow Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL (hybrid)</strong></p><p><strong>Salary: $110k annual + benefits</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Note: Need local profiles or who are willing to relocate. </strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p>Primary Skills:</p><ul><li>Advanced Hands-on development experience of ServiceNow scripting like Business Rule, Script includes, Fix scripts workflows, UI Action, UI Policy, Client scripts, Email Inbound</li><li>Good experience of Service Portal and widget creation</li><li>Very good experience of REST and SOAP based integration, scripted REST and SOAP API creation</li><li>Implemented ServiceNow project in Domain separated instance</li><li>Experienced in implementation on ServiceNow Discovery, Service Mapping, Event Management and Orchestration use cases.</li></ul>

title: Application Engineer
description: <strong>Company Overview<br><br></strong>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<br><br>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<br><br>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<br><br><strong>Department Overview<br><br></strong>Motorola Solutions creates innovative, mission-critical communication solutions and services that help public safety and commercial customers build safer cities and thriving communities around the world.<br><br>We look for the most advanced problems solvers - like you - to help us create technologies that rise to the challenges of our customers. To connect firefighters to police officers to emergency responders to nurses to specialists to lives saved. To protect communities, grow businesses and make work safer and more efficient. The Dispatch Consoles team focuses on a set of products purpose built for mission-critical operation over public safety communication networks. Dispatch Consoles provide a view into the communications system, with ability to monitor multiple communications channels simultaneously. Radio Dispatch operators and 911 call-takers use<br><br>the Dispatch Console to communicate with first responders in the field and coordinate incident management among police, fire, emergency medical and other agencies.<br><br>Motorola Dispatch Consoles inter-operate with a wide array of communications technologies including analog and digital radio channels, tone paging, telephone; and also supports auxiliary connections for sensors, I/O controls and additional peripherals devices such as speakers, microphones, and headsets. Dispatch Consoles bring these elements together in a single product designed to present information from these sources in efficient workflows to help first responders perform their duties quickly and accurately.<br><br>Motorola IP-based Dispatch Consoles enable effective, secure communication over public safety communication networks to keep responders connected and informed when it matters most.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>Positions are available for a self-motivated, advanced problem solver Engineer that has a desire to work on a wide range of products, applications, and services in a DevOps environment. The position will work with developers across multiple development sites to deliver high quality Mission Critical IP-based Dispatch Console software.<br><br>Analyzes, develops, designs, and maintains software for the organization’s products and systems. Performs system integration of software and hardware to maintain throughput and program consistency. Develops, validates, and tests: structures and user documentation.<br><br>Motorola Solutions is looking for candidates with strong interests in:<br><ul><li>Developing cutting edge secure digital communication solutions for Public Safety and First Responders</li><li>Information Security practices and secure software development methodologies and techniques</li><li>Secure protocols, key management, Public Key Infrastructure</li><li>Software development for 2-Way Radio Mission Critical Communication Systems<br><br></li></ul>Candidates are expected to work in a team environment utilizing the latest industry standard agile practices for planning, implementing, and delivering products and services.<br><br>Desired Skills:<br><ul><li>Team software development using Agile/SAFe practices. Experience with SDLC as well as awareness of Agile methodologies</li><li>Software virtualization practices and understanding of cloud based solutions</li><li>Knowledge of Network concepts such as bandwidth, packet loss, latency, caching, etc. </li><li>VMware virtual Networking concepts (virtual switches, virtual Ethernet Adapters, VLANs)</li><li>Strong Linux skills Hands-on development experience with Node.js and client side javascript frameworks (Angular, REACT)</li><li>Hands-on experience with Typescript, Python, HTML5, RESTful web services, OpenAPI/Swagger, JSON, and XML</li><li>Microservices, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis</li><li>Broad understanding of DevOps Tools including source control, continuous integrations, Infrastructure automation, deployment automation and orchestration (Tools such as github workflows, Jenkins, Bitbucket, Ansible, Kubernetes, OpenShift or similar toolsets)</li><li>Security concepts such as authentication, access control, authorization, cryptography, and least privilege</li><li>Experience writing SQL queries and connecting to Database backends</li><li>Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong Collaboration skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline is required. </li><li>2+ years of experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Travel Requirements<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Relocation Provided<br><br></strong>Domestic<br><br><strong>Position Type<br><br></strong>Experienced<br><br><strong>Referral Payment Plan<br><br></strong>Yes<br><br><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:<br></strong><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!<br><br></li></ul><em><strong>EEO Statement<br><br></strong></em>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

title: Application Engineer
description: <strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>This position will be responsible for maintaining and managing the Enterprise TEM service for Walgreens.<br><br>The resource will work closely with our external TEM vendor, Calero, our key telecom carrier and network service partners, and our internal IT Finance team to ensure the timely and accurate payment of monthly expenses, budgeting, accruals, forecast planning, reporting, internal BU (Business Unit) allocations, etc.<br><br>Performs and implements assignments that impact important /complicated components/processes of the specified functional area of the Technology operation. Work is received in short- and mid-term assignments that are important / complicated undertakings and regularly require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of approved methods.<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities</strong> <ul><li>Actively participates in the daily operational activities that impact important components / processes of the of the IT work function, and may include responsibilities, such as:</li><ul><li>Execution of deployment operations to monitor and improve on pre-release, upgrades and current versions of software. </li><li>Evaluating compatibility of programs with existing hardware and/or software features. </li><li>Development of protocols to support established standards. </li><li>Improving operation and monitoring of advanced or complex features. </li><li>Development of processes and interface requirements. </li><li>Data development and definition of acceptance criteria. </li></ul><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. Facilitates elimination of problems and roadblocks before they occur. </li><li>Works cross-functionally to accomplish assignments. Interacts with internal and external peers and managers to exchange complex information related to areas of specialization. </li><li>Mentors less experienced members of the team. </li><li>May assist in live site support and incident resolution that may include on-call rotation. </li></ul><strong>An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans<br><br></strong><strong>About Walgreens Boots Alliance<br><br></strong>Walgreens Boots Alliance (Nasdaq: WBA) is a global leader in retail pharmacy, impacting millions of lives every day through dispensing medicines, and providing accessible, high-quality care. With more than 170 years of trusted healthcare heritage and innovation in community pharmacy, the company is meeting customers’ and patients’ needs through its convenient retail locations, digital platforms and health and beauty products.<br><br>Including equity method investments, WBA has a presence in more than 25 countries, employs more than 450,000 people and has more than 21,000 stores.<br><br>WBA’s purpose is to help people across the world lead healthier and happier lives. The company is proud of its contributions to healthy communities, a healthy planet, an inclusive workplace and a sustainable marketplace. WBA is a participant of the United Nations Global Compact and adheres to its principles-based approach to responsible business.<br><br>WBA is included in FORTUNE’s 2021 list of the World’s Most Admired Companies*. This is the 28th consecutive year that WBA or its predecessor company, Walgreen Co., has been named to the list.<br><br>More company information is available at www.walgreensbootsalliance.com.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree and at least 2 years of experience in a technical engineering role, such as software development, release management, deployment engineering, site operations, technical operations or similar OR High school / GED and at least 5 years of experience in a technical engineering role, such as software development, release management, deployment engineering, site operations, technical operations or similar. </li><li>Experience in Technology infrastructure, such as Network, Monitoring, Systems, Databases, etc. </li><li>Experience establishing &amp; maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization, in the business community &amp; with vendors. </li><li>Experience using time management skills such as prioritizing/organizing and tracking details and meeting deadlines of multiple projects with varying completion dates</li><li>Experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions. </li><li>Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior background in Telecom Expense Management, ideally with Calero VeraSMART (although not an absolute requirement)</li><li>Fundamental understanding of telecom terminology and services</li><li>Strong Excel skills</li><li>Familiarity with basic SAP financials</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Enforces methodology for review, audit and approve vendor payments</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills</li><li>Provides outstanding customer service skills to direct and indirect customers</li><li>A high-level understanding of voice and data circuit billing, practical knowledge of CPE, cellular and project-related expenses. </li><li>Able to provide monthly OpEx financial reports</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics or equivalent experience and a minimum of 5 years prior relevant TEM experience. </li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems. </li><li>Experience with programming languages, nice to have</li><li>Knowledge of IT technologies</li></ul>

maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization, in the business community &amp; with vendors. </li><li>Experience using time management skills such as prioritizing/organizing and tracking details and meeting deadlines of multiple projects with varying completion dates</li><li>Experience analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions. </li><li>Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior background in Telecom Expense Management, ideally with Calero VeraSMART (although not an absolute requirement)</li><li>Fundamental understanding of telecom terminology and services</li><li>Strong Excel skills</li><li>Familiarity with basic SAP financials</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Enforces methodology for review, audit and approve vendor payments</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills</li><li>Provides outstanding customer service skills to direct and indirect customers</li><li>A high-level understanding of voice and data circuit billing, practical knowledge of CPE, cellular and project-related expenses. </li><li>Able to provide monthly OpEx financial reports</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics or equivalent experience and a minimum of 5 years prior relevant TEM experience. </li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems. </li><li>Experience with programming languages, nice to have</li><li>Knowledge of IT technologies</li></ul>

title: ServiceNow Developer
description: Matter is a Build as a Service (BaaS) agency that empowers businesses to build better technology. We specialize in custom software development and team building to help our clients engineer transformative results across their organization. We're a geo-diverse and dynamic team with deep backgrounds across product, engineering, and design and we are always looking for exceptional talent.<br><br>We are a remote-first team who believes in the intentional building of our team, processes and culture. If you are someone who thinks beyond just an engineering perspective and raises product concerns as you see them, takes pride of ownership in your work and is interested in learning, picking up new languages and personal growth, then Matter could be a great fit for you.<br><br><strong>Location<br></strong><ul><li>Remote OK; Domestic US<br><br></li></ul><strong>Summary<br><br></strong>Matter's software engineers work across multiple industries with companies of all shapes and sizes — from pre-Series A to S&amp;P 500 organizations. Our engineers need to be adaptable, proactive, and skilled in all areas of building technology. At Matter, we're working on building a fully remote, diverse, talented group of the "right" people that enable organizations across the world to build better technology.<br><br><strong>What You'll Be Doing<br></strong><ul><li>Work on multiple teams to architect, build, deploy, maintain, and improve software applications for Matter Product Studio's clients. </li><li>Deal with a wide variety of frameworks and projects. Some of our clients are launching their first mobile product, others need support on existing complex applications, and others we work alongside an existing engineering team in co-development. </li><li>Architect APIs, complex business logic, build beautiful frontends, and implement 3rd party integrations working alongside other curious engineers and team members. </li><li>Share responsibility for reviewing pull requests to ensure code quality and applications are maintainable and scalable. </li><li>Train and mentor junior engineers in their development growth. </li><li>Collaborate with designers and product managers on the implementation of requirements and client specifications. </li><li>Write automated tests. </li><li>Contribute to Matter's growing internal Best Practices and Product Engineering Methodology documentation. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>4+ years of software development experience. </li><li>3+ years of experience with React and React Native</li><li>2+ years of experience with a commonly used backend language</li><li>An understanding of software development best practices and a commitment to following them. </li><li>Comfort in reviewing others' code and providing meaningful and clear feedback to overall improve a code base. </li><li>Comfort with paired programming and teaching other engineers on best practices, solutions, and implementation. </li><li>Take pride and ownership in what you build. </li><li>Ability to effectively communicate via written and spoken English. </li><li>Ability to work 40 hours per week. </li><li>❓[OPTIONAL] ADD ANY OTHER REQUIREMENTS FOR A CLIENT-SPECIFIC ROLE<br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits<br></strong><ul><li>Fully remote organization</li><li>Unlimited PTO</li><li>Qualified QSE Plan for Health Care, applicable to medical, dental, and vision</li><li>Flexible work schedule</li><li>Wellness Benefits</li><li>Commuter Benefits<br><br></li></ul><strong>At Matter our mission is simple: </strong>bring together the <strong>right people</strong> to engineer transformative teams that result in unparalleled service and experiences for our clients. We strive to create a remote culture of empowerment, teamwork, and excellence.

We strive to create a remote culture of empowerment, teamwork, and excellence.

title: Senior Financial Reporting Analyst
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>Since 1922, Shorr has been providing its customers with products and services designed to deliver the best packaging solutions with an ongoing focus on innovation and progress. Steeped in the tradition of a family business Shorr proudly offers its customers a unique combination of in-depth business knowledge and personal service and our employee’s ownership in our success. Shorr Packaging has experienced significant growth year over year. Our growth can be directly tied to our culture of employee ownership and unparalleled customer service and support.<br><br>As an employee-owned company since 1984, every member of the Shorr Packaging team is committed to the company's success. Today, Shorr has employee owners in branch locations across the U.S. and represents premier manufacturers like 3M, Pregis, and Lantech.<br><br>The solution to our success is our people, both our customers and our employee owners.<br><br>This position is a hybrid role relying on the candidate to act as both architect and developer. This position is responsible f or guiding the direction and approach for architecture within the Shorr Salesforce environment while also being hands on and developing when necessary.<br><br>The ideal candidate is positive, solution-oriented, understands Salesforce features and functionality, and is focused on data governance, process, and best practices. Additionally, this candidate will be viewed as a leader, influencer and must possess very strong communication skills.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Develop a technical vision and roadmap to match overall company Salesforce strategy and vision </li><li> Present architecture options and recommendations following best practices ensuring an optimized, secure, and scalable system </li><li> Guide the direction, quality, and approach for architecture of Salesforce across Shorr with clear deliverables like architecture diagrams and documentation </li><li> Use your Salesforce technical development expertise to design and develop solutions for new strategic projects while also supporting incoming production requests </li><li> Educate and demonstrate to the business and IT organizations Salesforce capabilities and integration points, understand their challenges and develop automated solutions </li><li> Review the existing systems landscape and provide guidance on optimization and automation while balancing the need for custom code and configuration </li><li> Monitor the platform, ensure that all flows are documented, evaluate new functionalities, suggest and lead process improvement initiatives addressing gaps across all three pillars: business processes, people knowledge and system enhancements </li><li> Discover processes that can be automated to simplify the user experience for our end-users and customers, then design and execute elegant solutions </li><li> Manage environments, deployments, data cleansing, package installations &amp; data import tasks <br><br></li></ul>Qualifications:<br><ul><li>7+ years of established leadership experience in Salesforce delivery</li><li>Able to work in a fast-paced environment, multi-task, prioritize multiple projects, and be a proactive problem solver</li><li>Able to lead and drive complex operational initiatives and can demonstrate an ability to create clarity for their team</li><li>Track record of Salesforce.com experience as a developer with extensive knowledge of Sales, Service, Marketing, and Commerce Clouds; SOQL, Apex, VisualForce, Lightning Web Components, and Force.com tools and applications, preferably in an instance with 500+ end-users</li><li>Experience with Order Management, Revenue Cloud, and/or ServiceMax are a plus</li><li>High level knowledge with Boomi a plus<br><br></li></ul> Shorr Packaging Corp. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Female/Male/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity) that provides our employee owners with excellent compensation and benefits including 401K, employee stock (ESOP), medical, dental, life, and more.
description_json: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>Since 1922, Shorr has been providing its customers with products and services designed to deliver the best packaging solutions with an ongoing focus on innovation and progress. Steeped in the tradition of a family business Shorr proudly offers its customers a unique combination of in-depth business knowledge and personal service and our employee’s ownership in our success. Shorr Packaging has experienced significant growth year over year. Our growth can be directly tied to our culture of employee ownership and unparalleled customer service and support.<br><br>As an employee-owned company since 1984, every member of the Shorr Packaging team is committed to the company's success. title: Software Engineer
description: <ul><li>Description:* The company is looking for a way to aggregate, analyze, categorize, and present that data to stakeholders / leadership. Currently the only way they can do this is manually looking through every claim and to move to an excel spreadsheet.<br><br></li></ul>Solution:<br><br>They want to use our consultant to: Review customer facing failure data for warranty claims Analyze Data to identify trends and insights Find and define problem statement(s) Use Excel, Python, or R to help triage and compile the data into actionable groupings Visualize data in tools like Tableau or PowerBI Major plus if they have mechanical/electrical competency so they can relate to the componentry that the warranty claims are coming from and the teams they will be interfacing with.<br><ul><li>Skills:* Data analysis, Data, Analysis, Microsoft excel, PowerBI, tableau, python, R</li><li>Top Skills Details:* Data analysis</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:* 3+ years of data science experience strong data analysis experience Experience with python experience with data visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau Strong Excel experience Plus if they have experience with electronics or mechanical assemblies</li><li>Experience Level:* Intermediate Level<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. title: Salesforce Architect
description: Remote Opportunity (US)<br><ul><li>US Citizenship Required<br></li></ul>We are looking for an Appian Developer that will be part of an Agile development team with a passion for supporting an Enterprise Level Application. This is a full telework role that offers the ability to obtain a government public trust and DOD level certifications!<br><br>The Appian Developer will provide technical, managerial, and administrative direction for problem definition, analysis, requirements development, and implementation for complex to extremely complex systems in the subject matter area. Make recommendations and advise on organization-wide system improvements, optimization or maintenance efforts in the following specialties information systems architecture; networking; telecommunications; automation; communications protocols; risk management/electronic analysis; software; lifecycle management; software development methodologies; and modeling and simulation. Commensurate experience in IT and in new and related older technology that directly relates to the required area of expertise.<br><br><strong><u>Job Duties<br></u></strong><ul><li>Focus on business logic and process flows, working on the design and development of business logic, process models/flows and UI screens to implement in a BPM (Business Process Management)-based system.</li><li>Work closely with Business Analyst to investigate customers' requirements, prototype business solutions, and validate user story acceptance criteria.</li><li>Coordinate closely with team members to ensure proper implementation of fixes, unit testing, and configuration management.</li><li>Review Appian development and sign off on design and implementation.</li><li>Develop and maintain Appian Business Process Management (BPM) solutions, including plug-in development.</li><li>Develop Structured Query Language (SQL), update data models and implement common database best practices (indexes, triggers, and data structure).</li><li>Unit testing, technical problem determination and debugging.</li><li>Manage daily work in the Atlassian suite of applications (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket and Bamboo).</li><li>Coordinate with DevOps team member to ensure timely and reliable release to customer.</li><li>Ensure software maintains data integrity, security and best practice standards.</li><li>Mentor junior BPM developers to improve capabilities of the team.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field or equivalent relevant experience.<br><br>5-10 years of experience with programming or web development activities.<br><br>(CASP+ CE, CISSP (associate) or CSSLP) at time of hire or within 6 months of start date<br><br><strong><u>Additional Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Appian software development experience.</li><li>Experience in BPM (Appian, JBoss BPMS, Activiti, Oracle or IBM BPM, Pega, etc.).</li><li>Current Appian credentials as Designer, Lead Designer or Developer.</li><li>Using one or more Appian add-on tools, such as Expression Unit Tests, Deployment Automation Manager, FitNesse test creation, SAIL UI and Smart Services.</li><li>Appian 7.x/20.x version design, implementation and ability to translate software requirements specifications into Appian applications and prototype.</li><li>Knowledge of Appian software design, web development and design languages.</li><li>Understanding and hands-on experience with Agile software development methodologies.</li><li>Strong desire to learn customer business processes.<br></li></ul>#cjpost

title: Test & Validation Engineer
description: <strong>POSITION SUMMARY:<br><br></strong>The Infrastructure Security Engineer will work collectively across teams in implementing and maintaining the configurations of our various physical and cloud-based systems. This position will be responsible for implementing the firm’s security and risk requirements to ensure compliance. The Infrastructure Security Engineer role will reside on the infrastructure team and will report to the infrastructure manager. Required to collaborate with other infrastructure engineers (network/systems/storage/virtualization/cloud), security architect, security team, desktop architect, and various support teams to apply our security best practices.<br><br>Thorough understanding of network and security solutions, hardware, and fundamental security best practices are vital to this role.<br><br><strong>DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Work with infrastructure and security teams to manage and maintain network firewalls and security equipment.</li><li>Primary point of contact and resource for security and risk related network infrastructure projects.</li><li>Implement, manage, and maintain the firm’s endpoint security plan and authentication (NAC)</li><li>Troubleshoot and provide support for various infrastructure and security systems as required.</li><li>Work collectively with our network and security team to plan and strategize on network and security roadmaps. Study network architecture and make recommendations and identify solutions. Work in conjunction with our security team to conduct risk assessments.</li><li>Implement new network designs, take part in continual improvement and equipment life cycle management across our offices – globally. <br><br></li></ul><strong>BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology with 4 + years equivalent work experience required.</li><li> At least 5 years of experience and direct “hands-on” knowledge maintaining network equipment and information security systems required.<br><br></li></ul><strong>ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><ul><li> Knowledge of enterprise networks and security infrastructure. NAC, NPS, communication and internet security systems, remote access VPN, firewalls, and wireless security infrastructure.</li><li> Knowledge and experience with the following:</li><ul><li>NAC/802.1x implementations and controls using Aruba Clearpass.</li><li>Palo Alto firewalls – physical and virtual in Azure</li><li>Meraki firewalls</li><li>Silverpeak SDWAN – physical and virtual in Azure</li><li>Cisco switching</li><li>Cisco Anyconnect VPN</li><li>Palo Alto Prisma VPN</li><li>Network segmentation and isolation<br><br><br></li></ul></ul><strong>COMPETENCIES<br><br></strong><ul><li>Must possess excellent communication, documentation, and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Strong technical knowledge across a variety of systems – integration of infrastructure and security devices with Active Directory, various MFA, and SSO systems.</li><li>Knowledge of LAN and WAN technologies, VPN, MPLS, ISPs, Silver Peak SD-WAN, failover, and high availability.</li><li>Design and implementation of various network segmentation strategies.</li><li>Requires after-hours, weekends and on-call work as needed.</li><li>Interact with all levels of management and teams within IS.</li><li>Ability to travel to Winston offices and or vendor locations as required.<br><br></li></ul>We value diversity in the workplace. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled (EOE=Equal Opportunity Employer)<br><br>

title: Test & Validation Engineer
description: Location(s)<p><br></p>Alpharetta GA, Chicago IL, Dallas TX, McAllen TX<p><br></p><strong>Details</strong><p><br></p><em>Kemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Our success is a direct reflection of the talented and diverse people who make a positive difference in the lives of our customers every day. We believe a high-performing culture, valuable opportunities for personal development and professional challenge, and a healthy work-life balance can be highly motivating and productive. Kemper’s products and services are making a real difference to our customers, who have unique and evolving needs. By joining our team, you are helping to provide an experience to our stakeholders that delivers on our promises.</em><p><br></p>The Cloud Contact Center Developer/Engineer is a technical implementation role who will focus on delivering cloud-based contact center solutions. This role will work directly with customers to capture business requirements, share best practices, make recommendations, document the optimal design, and build the approved solution. This role will support business development activities by providing demos of contact center products. This position will focus on customer interaction applications that will leverage Amazon Web Services (AWS) services and will have daily interaction with Kemper’s Advanced Engineering team.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Ensure customer success in building and launching Amazon Connect solutions.</li><li> Educate business stakeholders on the value proposition of Amazon Connect and AWS, and participate and/or lead deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.</li><li> Conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to business stakeholders or operations support team.</li><li> Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS solutions architect community.</li><li> Author or contribute to Amazon Connect or AWS customer-facing publications such as whitepapers, blogs or technical guides.</li><li> Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within business to enable them to be cloud advocates.</li><li> Act as technical liaison between business stakeholders, vendor partners, engineering teams and operations support.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Telecommunications, Computer Science or related field, or related work experience. </li><li> 5+ years hands-on experience with contact center technology including networking and telecommunications engineering, telephony systems (including ACD and call automation), vendor and service management and IT security </li><li> 3+ years working with cloud contact center services (Amazon Connect experience required) </li><li> 3+ years in vendor and service management, including cloud-based services </li><li> Strong understanding of the Amazon Connect platform including contact flows, contact routing, queues and agent setup </li><li> Strong knowledge of AWS services and cloud architecture, specifically the services that impact Connect including Lambda, DynamoDB, Lex, Polly, Cloud Watch and Cloud Formation </li><li> Experience with communications protocols (i.e., WebRTC, SIP) and APIs </li><li> Experience with scripting (e.g., Java, Python, Angular, .NET, Node.js) </li><li> Experience building integrations across WFM, CRM, and contact center solutions </li><li> Experience managing projects or complex engagements involving multiple stakeholders </li><li> Proven experience in the administration of Contact Center application technologies with expertise in call routing, call recording, IVR/self-service, scripting and workforce management. </li><li> Experience with Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS), Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) and cloud-based telephony services such as Amazon Connect, Microsoft Teams or similar. </li><li> Comfortable working in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment with often-ambiguous business requirements and multiple competing priorities. </li><li> Must be agile, team-oriented and organized. </li><li> This position is a remote role and can work from a US based home. </li><li>Sponsorship not accepted for this opportunity.</li></ul><p><br></p>The range for this position is $76,600 to $102,500. When determining candidate offers, we consider experience, skills, education, certifications, and geographic location among other factors.  This job is eligible for an annual discretionary bonus and Kemper benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, 401k, etc.)  <p><br></p><em>Kemper is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We are committed to supporting diversity and equality across our organization and we work diligently to maintain a workplace free from discrimination. </em><p><br></p><em>Kemper does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Kemper and Kemper will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. </em><p><br></p><em>Kemper will never request personal information, such as your social security number or banking information, via text or email. If you receive such a message, delete it</em>

title: Appian Developer III
description: <strong>Looking for the next step in your career? Enjoy a challenge? Do you have an ambition for innovation? Want to make a difference? <br><br></strong>If you join our growing global team, you’ll be working for an industry leader with offices across five continents, in over 47 countries and more than 28 000 employees. You will work with some of the leading world brands across the Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies – who are all relying on Dimension Data to help them use the power of technology to achieve their ambition in this digital era.You’ll be part of a team who’s passionate about making a difference to the way technology shapes how we live and work – whether it’s protecting the rhino, connecting the G20 Summit, or revolutionising cycling, giving you the opportunity to do great things.<br><br>You’ll be joining a Global Top Employer, recognised for investing in talent because people are at the heart of our success. You provide the skills, passion and ideas, and we’ll provide the platform to realise your ambitions.Great talent. Great teams. Great work. Great opportunities.<br><br><strong>Want to be part of our team?<br><br></strong>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<br><br><strong>What You'll Be Doing<br><br></strong>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. </li><li>Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. </li><li>Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. </li><li>Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. </li><li>Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. </li><li>Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. </li><li>May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. </li><li>Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. </li><li>Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:<br></strong><ul><li>Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles</li><li>Demonstrates project management and administration ability</li><li>Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments</li><li>Demonstrate customer engagement skills</li><li>Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge</li><li>Good verbal communication skills</li><li>Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems</li><li>Ability to work under pressure</li><li>Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members</li><li>Good understanding of project management principles<br><br></li></ul><strong>Academic Qualifications and Certifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent</li><li>Project management certification<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role</li><li>Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations</li><li>Good project administration and documentation experience</li><li>Report writing experience</li><li>Basic project management<br><br></li></ul><strong>What would make you a good fit for this role?<br><br></strong><strong>Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.<br><br></strong><strong>Equal opportunity employer <br><br></strong>We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.

user requirements to define business objectives Envisioning system features and functionality Define application objectives and functionality Ensure application designs conform with business goals Develop and test software Identify and resolve any technical issues arising Create detailed design documentation Propose changes to current.<br><br></em><em><strong>Experience 8to10Yrs<br><br>Required designed, testable code<br><br>" Conducting software analysis, programming, testing, and debugging<br><br>" Manage Java and Java EE application development<br><br>" Develop documentation to help users Transforming requirements into stipulations<br><br>" Prepare and produce releases of software components<br><br>" Support continuous improvement, investigating alternatives and technologies, and presenting for architectural review<br><br><strong><u>Some Of The Java Developer Key Skills Include<br><br></u></strong>" Proficiency in Java, with a good understanding of its ecosystems<br><br>" Sound knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) Patterns and Concepts Familiarity with different design and architectural patterns<br><br>" Skill for writing reusable Java libraries Knowhow of Java concurrency patterns<br><br>" Basic Understanding of the concepts of MVC (Model-View-Controller) Pattern, JDBC (Java Database Connectivity), and RESTful web services<br><br>" Experience in working with popular web application frameworks like Play and Spark Relevant<br><br>" Knowledge of Java GUI frameworks like Swing, SWT, AWT according to project requirements<br><br>" Ability to write clean, readable Java code<br><br>" Basic knowhow of class loading mechanism in Java Experience in handling external and embedded databases<br><br>" Understanding basic design principles behind a scalable application<br><br>" Skilled at creating database schemas that characterize and support business processes Basic knowledge of JVM (Java Virtual Machine)<br><br></em>

title: Engineer II (Embedded Systems Engineer)
description: <ul><li>Actalent connects passion with purpose. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts that drive scale, innovation, and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 engineering and sciences consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia, and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500. An operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions, Actalent launched as a new specialized engineering and sciences services and workforce solutions brand in 2021.*</li><li>Description:* Assists with Installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and maintaining a variety of coordinate measuring machines (CMM), machine tools and accessories.<br><br></li></ul>Assists with identifying analyzing and repairing failures, orders and replaces parts as needed.<br><br>Provides some customer training.<br><ul><li>Assists with the installation and machine maintenance including diagnosis, repairs, troubleshooting, certifications, and re-calibration of various machines at the customer sites to conform to factory specifications and accuracy standards.</li><li>Answers basic customer questions about product features</li><li>Supports basic service calls to customer sites to correct problems involving company products, diagnoses and corrects basic problems, and performs related duties to customer satisfaction</li><li>Assists with technical support to other service representatives and customers</li><li>Ensures prompt preparation and completion of service and expense reporting</li><li>Provides the highest customer satisfaction in a professional manner</li><li>Provides basic mechanical tasks including assembly, disassembly, leveling, diagnosis and repair of issues on automated equipment</li><li>Provides basic electrical tasks including diagnosis, troubleshooting, and repair of control systems</li><li>Complete preventative maintenance and field modifications</li><li>Keeps up to date with administrative responsibilities such as customer service logs and internal service records</li><li>Maintains tools and test equipment ensuring they are properly calibrated</li><li>Maintains daily communications with customers ensuring resolution and proper follow-up to any issues</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:* Minimum 1 year of experience as a service technician (can be from school or working on things at home) Okay with 100% travel M-F Electrical and mechanical troubleshooting low voltage</li><li>Employee Perks: *</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>PTO &amp; Holiday Pay</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Why Actalent? *</li><li>Actalent is an equal opportunity employer.</li><li>Work with a dedicated career partner specialized in your skill set</li><li>We advocate on your behalf so you get what you want and need out of your job</li><li>Get performance feedback, career advice, and access to ongoing professional development tools</li><li>Build your career and learn new skills through projects as diverse as your curiosity</li><li>If you are interested in learning more, please send your resume to jkowalski@actalentservices.com<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Test Engineer
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Testing position?*</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for an on-site Test Engineer with experience in the automotive industry. This team is responsible for developing custom proprietary vehicle diagnostic and data acquisition tools used to test off-highway vehicles. Most of this role will be in CAN data with a portion of bench level testing, you may be required from time to time to build your own custom harness to modify harnesses and writing diagrams. Experience with software testing, bug identification, and electrical testing is a must!</li><li>Description:*</li><li>Configure, test and install data acquisition devices and related hardware on Agricultural Machinery:</li><li>This activity would involve using software to configure data acquisition devices, various sensors, CSM Modules etc, build/modify existing harnesses to connect the device and sensors to the specific machinery, test them on bench setup, verify for proper configuration and data quality, ship/install the data acquisition devices securely on the machinery. Write detailed documents showing installation and data downloading procedure.</li><li>Support in data analysis process:</li><li>This task includes specific actions related to data analysis process (Download data from the DAQ devices, data conversion, monitoring data quality, transferring data to a server(AZURE). It might also include analyzing data using NI DIAdem software. Prepare detailed PPT's of analysis and present it to relevant groups.</li><li>Test and validation:</li><li>Includes test and validation of telemetry platform new and existing features.</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>BS in Electrical Engineering or similar</li><li>Strong experience testing software and hardware</li><li>Must have experience with finding bugs in Software</li><li>Experience with electrical based testing with test tools</li><li>MUST have experience with CANalyzer, CAN or Vector Test tools</li><li>Must have automotive or similar industry experience</li><li>C++ and Python</li><li>Experience Level:* Junior to Mid Level<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Software Developer
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>As a Manager in the Forensic Technology Services team, the candidate will be responsible for driving the process of eDiscovery for our clients.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Responding directly to client requests and providing consultation within the framework of the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) including working closely with digital forensics and managed review teams </li><li> Developing, actively communicating, and managing project plans for clients including consultation on processes and tools to meet project goals </li><li> Executing against agreed to e-discovery protocols and regulatory processing and production requirements </li><li> Competency in end-to-end platform solutions, such as RelativityOne, including knowledge of processing workflows, early case assessment, review workflows, appropriate use and application of analytic tools and methodologies, machine translation workflows and complex production workflows </li><li> Proficiency and demonstrated experience in adopting, leveraging and applying advanced analytic applications such as H5 Matter Analytics, the Reveal Data suite (Reveal, NexLP and Brainspace) and the ever-evolving suite of technology </li><li> Be able to consult on technology assisted review applications and a basic understanding of algorithms and workflow with willingness to continue to develop this skillset </li><li> The ability to analyze and provide meaningful insights, interpretations and guidance by leveraging data intelligence and mining solutions (e.g. SmartSheet, Microsoft PowerBI, Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, trend analyses) to educate and consult with clients </li><li> Ability to manage multiple workstreams across the assigned portfolio of clients; including both upstream escalation paths and downstream day-to-day management </li><li> Staying on top of trends, new tools, and overall knowledge of the e-discovery marketplace in the service of our clients </li><li> Strong ability to translate highly technical information to non-technical clients </li><li> Exceptional organizational skills </li><li> Perform other related duties as required </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree, required </li><li> Juris Doctorate, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Five (5) or more years of e-discovery project experience, required </li><li> Experience in project management for e-discovery managed services, preferred </li><li> Experience with multi-matter repositories and migrating large quantities of data across workspaces and platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>License/Certifications</strong>  <ul><li> Two (2) or more Relativity certifications are strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Relativity Certified Administrator, preferred </li><li> RelativityOne Reviewer Pro, Relativity Analytics Specialist, and/or Relativity Project Management Specialist are strongly encouraged </li></ul><li> One (1) or more Reveal Data suite certifications strongly preferred. Example certifications include:</li><ul><li> Brainspace Analyst, Specialist, and/or Admin Certification, preferred </li><li> NexLP is a plus </li></ul><li> ACEDS' Certified E-Discovery Specialist Certification, eDiscovery Executive Certificate, and/or eDiscovery Technology Certificate is preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Software</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proficient in RelativityOne and Brainspace, required </li><li> Proficiency in H5, and a general understanding of machine language translation tools, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in Microsoft Advanced E-Discovery, preferred </li><li> Proficiency in other eDiscovery platforms, preferred </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Other Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Strong analytical and critical thinking skills </li><li> Proven ability to work in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Solid organizational skills especially the ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details and quality </li><li> Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment </li><li> Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and client personnel </li><li> Provide an encouraging team atmosphere on engagements and contribute to the professional development of the team </li><li> Foreign language skills, specifically in Mandarin, Cantonese, French, German, and/or Hindi is not required, but would be a strong benefit </li></ul><p><br></p>Individual salaries that are offered to a candidate are determined after consideration of numerous factors including but not limited to the candidate’s qualifications, experience, skills, and geography.<p><br></p>California Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p>Washington Range: $100,000 - $120,000<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>BDO delivers assurance, tax, digital technology solutions and financial advisory services to clients throughout the country and around the globe. We offer numerous industry-specific practices, world-class resources, and an unparalleled commitment to meeting our clients’ needs. We currently serve more than 400 publicly traded domestic and international clients.<p><br></p><ul><li>Unparalleled partner-involvement </li><li>Deep industry knowledge and participation</li><li>Geographic coverage across the U.S.</li><li>Cohesive global network </li><li>Focused capabilities across disciplines</li></ul><p><br></p>BDO brings world-class resources and exceptional service to each and every one of our clients. BDO USA is a member of BDO International, the world’s fifth largest accounting network.<p><br></p>BDO offers a competitive Total Rewards package that encompass so much more than – “traditional benefits”. Our wide range of rewards and our employees’ ability to customize rewards to their individual needs are two of the reasons why BDO has been honored with so many workplace awards, including 100 Best Companies for Working Parents, Working Mother 100 Best Companies, Top Entry Level Employer, 2022 National Best &amp; Brightest Companies to Work For and more.<p><br></p><strong>Some Examples Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive pay and eligibility for an annual performance bonus. </li><li>A 401k plan plus an employer match</li><li>Comprehensive, medical, dental, vision, FSA, and prescription insurance from day one</li><li> Competitive Paid Time Off with daily accrual from day one of employment, plus paid holidays </li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Adoption Assistance</li><li>Firm paid life insurance</li><li>Wellness programs</li><li>Additional offerings include BDO Flex, Group Legal insurance, Pet insurance and Long-Term Care Insurance </li></ul><p><br></p>Above offerings may be subject to eligibility requirements.<p><br></p>Click here to find out more!<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.<p><br></p>BDO USA, LLP is an EO employer M/F/Veteran/Disability<p><br></p>

title: .Net Developer
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Firmware Engineering position? *</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for a Firmware Engineer to design, develop, document and analyze new and modified professional medical scale designs. This position would involve designing and developing embedded applications. You would be in charge of selecting and evaluating microprocessors, platforms, operating systems and firmware architecture solutions that meet performance and product cost needs. title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>When you work at Skiltrek , youre not just working at a global financial institution. Youre an integral part of one of the worlds biggest tech organizations. In our global technology centers, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry. At JPMorgan Chase &amp; Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and were building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If youre looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. This team- Digital Communications (Alerts vs notifications) SMS and push notifications- looking to continue to modernize and standardize across the firm<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>java, springboot, microservices, kafka, nosql, maven, docker, kubernetes<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>java,springboot,microservices,kafka<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Develop and deliver quality applications on-time, following project plans and delivery commitments; Perform frequent code reviews; Write high quality code that will serve as an example for other engineers. Disseminate the usage of unit, functional and integration tests among the team; Analysis and identification of technical areas of improvement within existing applications; Maintain current technical knowledge by documenting our applications; Deploy the applications you built to our cloud and monitor it; Follow the Agile ceremonies and its best practices; Lead an agile team compose by up to 8 software engineers, and guide them towards success; Perform frequent one on ones with the engineers in the team, and help them achieving their career goals; Desired Technical Qualifications At least 8 years of proven professional experience with Java; Excellent software engineering principles (data structures, multithreading and algorithms); Experience with Spring framework; Excellent relational databases skills; Excellent knowledge about application architecture, clean code and good practices; Very good knowledge about Kafka and its concepts; Nice to have: Experience with any NoSQL database; Experience using Docker; Experience in containerizing applications and using Kubernetes; Experience with Maven or Gradle; Previous experience<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>Expert Level<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US. At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances, be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Utilizing solid business experience, industry-specific expertise, and proven methodologies, we consistently deliver measurable results for our customers. Cerebra has partnered with leading enterprise software companies and cloud providers such as Oracle, Salesforce, Amazon and able to leverage these partner relationships to deliver high-quality, end-to-end customer solutions that are targeted to the needs of each customer.<br><br><strong>Java Kafka Developer <br><br></strong><strong>Location: Hybrid (Chicago IL ,3 Days onsite) <br><br></strong><strong>Duration: 7 Months <br><br></strong><strong>USC or GC only on W2 <br><br></strong><strong><u>What You Need To Succeed<br></u></strong><ul><li>At least 9+ years' experience in building highly scalable, high performance, and highly available back-end applications. </li><li>Kafka streaming experience </li><li>Experience with event driven framework </li><li>Strong Mongo DB skills and experience </li><li>Development expertise in REST/SOAP/JSON API. </li><li>Solid working knowledge of NoSQL (e.g., Elasticsearch + Time Series Databases). </li><li>Unix background with RedHat </li><li>Spring Cloud Stream preference skill </li><li>Payment's domain or financial industry experience </li><li>Experience with large volumes of data </li><li>Solid understanding of algorithm complexity, parallel/distributed systems, advanced data structures, computer networking, and operating systems. </li><li>Prior experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies. </li><li>Start-up environment experience will be a plus, although not mandatory. </li><li>Strength in backend service development </li><li>Self-initiating developer </li><li>Takes ownership and is reliable <br></li></ul><strong>Thanks <br><br></strong><strong>Sai Revanth <br><br></strong><strong>Email - revanth.patnala@cerebra-consulting.com <br><br></strong><strong>Phone| 8784256221</strong>

title: Servicenow developer
description: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. </li><li>Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications</li><li>Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. </li><li>Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. </li><li>Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. </li><li>Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. </li><li>Builds productive internal/external working relationships. </li><li>Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with superiors on unusual or complex matters</li><li>Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. </li><li>Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization</li><li>Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. </li><li>Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. </li><li>Acts as individual contributor as well as team member</li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. </li><li>Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. </li><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li></ul><strong>About Walgreens and WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree and at least 2 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience OR High School/ GED and at least 4 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience</li><li>Experience writing code for applications or automation</li><li>Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, APIs or mobile applications</li><li>Experience building, testing applications or
