description_json: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. </li><li>Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications</li><li>Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. </li><li>Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. </li><li>Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. </li><li>Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. </li><li>Builds productive internal/external working relationships. </li><li>Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. description: This role is with Ventas. WayUp is partnering with Ventas to hire top talent.<p><br></p> Job Description: <p><br></p> Position <p><br></p>Reporting to the Director, Business FP&amp;A, the Senior Financial Analyst, Business FP&amp;A will be instrumental in analyzing, understanding and communicating the key drivers of financial performance for the Company’s Life Science business to help drive its strategic goals and impact growth. The successful individual will combine an advanced analytical approach with focused critical reasoning to convert raw data into insightful financial analysis.<p><br></p> Responsibilities <p><br></p><ul><li>Provide visibility to the Ventas senior leadership and Life Science Asset Management teams regarding financial targets and portfolio performance vs. those targets; help management understand the key risks and opportunities to achieving the targets.</li><li>Undertake segment specific portfolio and asset-level analytics to assess the impact of development, redevelopment, leasing, operational changes, etc. on financial performance.</li><li>Develop a flexible financial model to provide real-time forecasts, allowing for a continuous assessment of opportunities and risks; continually update model assumptions.</li><li>Serve as key point of contact with Accounting and Asset Management for segment specific complex/special situations.</li><li>Support the Life Science budget, reforecast and related three-year strategic planning processes.</li><li>Provide overall analytic support as needed to the Life Science Asset Management team and senior management on key strategic initiatives and ad hoc requests.</li></ul><p><br></p> Qualifications <p><br></p><ul><li>3 to 5 years of progressive financial analysis or investment banking experience preferred</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Real Estate, Finance, Economics, Accounting or similar business field</li><li>Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to analyze data trends, draw conclusions and create presentable, understandable reports to senior management</li><li>Strong verbal, written &amp; interpersonal communication skills</li><li>Process and detail oriented; always looking for ways to improve processes</li><li>Intellectual curiosity</li><li>Ability to manage deadlines in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment</li></ul><p><br></p>Ventas, Inc. offers a competitive compensation and benefits package to the successful candidate.<p><br></p>Ventas, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.<p><br></p>Ventas, Inc. does not accept unsolicited resumes from staffing agencies, search firms or any third parties.

title: Java Engineer
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong><strong>Build Your Career at STV<br><br></strong>At STV, we not only tackle world-class projects, we also develop employee skills, recognize achievements, and offer opportunities for advancement. So, if you’re looking for a rewarding position working for an industry leader, then STV is the place for you. We are a well-respected AEC firm with 40 offices throughout the US and 2,400 employees.<br><br><strong>Grow at STV<br><br></strong>Life is an ongoing learning experience, and we want you to continue to grow here at STV. We offer several programs and benefits, from professional development seminars, tuition reimbursement program, a career development program, online education initiatives, and much more to help you expand your knowledge and develop your skills, so you can take your career to the next level with STV.<br><br><strong>Take Care of Your Personal &amp; Financial Health<br><br></strong>With a wide range of competitive benefit programs, we are committed to helping employees be personally and financially healthy and productive.<br><br>STV is seeking a <strong>Resident Engineer</strong> to oversee construction engineering and inspection duties for highway transportation projects and Federal-Local projects, in accordance with the Standard Specifications for Roads, Bridges. Individual must have considerable knowledge of highway, bridge, rail and facilities construction practices and procedures as required; ability to prepare correspondence, reports and recommendations concerning construction issues; and the ability to establish and maintain project records.<br><br><strong>Required Skills &amp; Required Experience<br></strong><ul><li>To qualify, candidates must possess a minimum of 5 years of experience in civil, highway or appropriate engineering field of which at least four (4) years shall be in field inspection activities.</li><li>Candidates must have knowledge of transportation facility, highway and bridge construction materials, methods and procedures as required; ability to write daily reports; ability to perform complex quantity and engineering computations; ability to read and interpret plans and specifications; ability to deal effectively with people. Familiarity with the IDOT Standard Specifications and knowledge of the CMMS software used by IDOT to establish and maintain project records are a plus, but not required at time of hire.</li><li>Considerable knowledge of construction materials, methods; ability to maintain field and office records; ability to perform complex quantity and engineering computations; ability to read and interpret plans and specifications; ability to deal effectively with people.</li><li>Professional Engineer's License registered in the State of Illinois (PE) required.</li><li>Must be able to fulfill essential job functions in a consistent state of alertness and safe manner<br><br></li></ul>Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<br><br>STV offers the following benefits<br><ul><li> Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account</li><li> Dental insurance</li><li> Vision insurance</li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable)</li><li> Disability insurance</li><li> Life Insurance and Accidental Death &amp; Dismemberment</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li> Retirement Counseling</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Paid Time Off (16 days)</li><li> Paid Holidays (8 days)</li><li> Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year)</li><li> Parental Leave (up to 80 hours)</li><li> Continuing Education Program</li><li> Professional Licensure and Society Memberships<br><br></li></ul>STV aims to pay fairly and equitable commensurate with experience and capabilities across all of our positions. These pay ranges represent a good faith effort to provide a fair and reasonable expected salary, however, please note that the salary offered for any position may be outside of this range based on selected candidate’s location, experience and capabilities.<br><br>STV is committed to paying all its employees in a fair, equitable, and transparent manner. The following pay ranges are STV’s good-faith salary estimates for every presently available position. Please note that the final salary offered for any position may be outside of this published range based on many factors, including but not limited to geography, education, experience, and/or certifications.<br><br>This list represents all of the currently listed positions as of November 1, 2022.<br><br>Position Title, Good Faith Salary Minimum, Good Faith Salary Maximum<br><br>Accounting Individual must have considerable knowledge of highway, bridge, rail and facilities construction practices and procedures as required; ability to prepare correspondence, reports and recommendations concerning construction issues; and the ability to establish and maintain project records.<br><br><strong>Required Skills &amp; Required Experience<br></strong><ul><li>To qualify, candidates must possess a minimum of 5 years of experience in civil, highway or appropriate engineering field of which at least four (4) years shall be in field inspection activities.</li><li>Candidates must have knowledge of transportation facility, highway and bridge construction materials, methods and procedures as required; ability to write daily reports; ability to perform complex quantity and engineering computations; ability to read and interpret plans and specifications; ability to deal effectively with people. Familiarity with the IDOT Standard Specifications and knowledge of the CMMS software used by IDOT to establish and maintain project records are a plus, but not required at time of hire.</li><li>Considerable knowledge of construction materials, methods; ability to maintain field and office records; ability to perform complex quantity and engineering computations; ability to read and interpret plans and specifications; ability to deal effectively with people.</li><li>Professional Engineer's License registered in the State of Illinois (PE) required.</li><li>Must be able to fulfill essential job functions in a consistent state of alertness and safe manner<br><br></li></ul>Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<br><br>STV offers the following benefits<br><ul><li> Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account</li><li> Dental insurance</li><li> Vision insurance</li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable)</li><li> Disability insurance</li><li> Life Insurance and Accidental Death &amp; Dismemberment</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li> Retirement Counseling</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Paid Time Off (16 days)</li><li> Paid Holidays (8 days)</li><li> Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year)</li><li> Parental Leave (up to 80 hours)</li><li> Continuing Education Program</li><li> Professional Licensure and Society Memberships<br><br></li></ul>STV aims to pay fairly and equitable commensurate with experience and capabilities across all of our positions. These pay ranges represent a good faith effort to provide a fair and reasonable expected salary, however, please note that the salary offered for any position may be outside of this range based on selected candidate’s location, experience and capabilities.<br><br>STV is committed to paying all its employees in a fair, equitable, and transparent manner. The following pay ranges are STV’s good-faith salary estimates for every presently available position. Please note that the final salary offered for any position may be outside of this published range based on many factors, including but not limited to geography, education, experience, and/or title: Front-end Engineer
description: Take your career to the next level as an embedded software engineer, using your expertise in embedded C and MATLAB/Simulink to develop advanced features for the off-highway autonomous vehicle industry and push the technology of flagship vehicles such as tractors, harvesters, combines, and excavators to the next level.<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and test software for enterprise programming and infrastructure solutions</li><li>Operate in a scrum team environment on varying project scope and direction from a project lead</li><li>Support the team with concept, development and testing of solutions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Software</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Embedded C/C++</li><li>MATLAB/Simulink</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated capability in software product development using C++, C, Python and scripting languages</li><li>Training or experience with Object-Oriented Analysis/Design (OOA/D) and multi-threaded systems</li><li>Experience that demonstrates you are a self-starter, and able to work well without close direction</li><li>Demonstrated capability performing in an engineering team environment and interfacing with engineers and personnel of other disciplines</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of software industry experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.<p><br></p>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Java Kafka Developer
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Your role in helping us shape the future:</strong><p><br></p>Using your expertise in cross-platform web application testing creating and using highly automated test frameworks, you will partner with software developers, internal business owners, and other departments to influence the performance of our products. Your ideas will continuously raise the bar – helping us find new paths and technologies to deliver best in class products and services.<p><br></p><strong>Are you up to the challenge?</strong><p><br></p>You have successfully built automation frameworks for desktop and mobile applications using open-source technologies like Selenium WebDriver, TestNG, and you have programming skills in Java, Python, or Ruby. You have a strong sense of responsibility, accountability and passion for technology, quality of work and desire to learn &amp; take ownership. You crave working cross-functionally in a fast-paced, agile environment (SAFe).<p><br></p><strong>Can you drive these processes?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Build test automation frameworks using Selenium with JAVA &amp; Cucumber to develop, maintain and continuously improve test automation and coverage</li><li>Perform systems analysis and collaborate with engineers across teams to build best in class testing approach and automation frameworks to support continuous integration and help improve testing and the quality of our code</li><li>Collaborate with development engineers to improve testing and the quality of our code.</li><li>Efficiently use CI tools like Jenkins to align with Dev-Ops Deployment process.</li><li>Use test management and error management tools like Zephyr and JIRA to collaborate with development engineers to improve testing. </li><li>Help design and implement performance and load testing.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You should definitely have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree and 2-5 years of experience or relevant work experience</li><li>Experience testing with Selenium using JAVA, JavaScript for testing and validation of Web UI, APIs, headless Functional Testing of JavaScript SDKs using WebKit Engine with full JS access.</li><li>Execute basic Bash and Ruby scripts, and work Git from the command line.</li><li>2 years of working experience with RESTful services and ideally WebSockets.</li><li>Understanding and experience of BDD/TDD strengths and weaknesses is a plus.</li><li>Understanding of modern web application architecture utilizing decoupled modules and independent subsystems.</li><li>Good understanding of databases with some experience with SQL and NoSQL.</li><li>Medium expertise with tools like Selenium web driver and Appium frameworks for all Webapps, Native &amp; Hybrid apps.</li><li>Expertise on Source management tools like Git and on build management tools like Gradle.</li><li>Understanding of Object-Oriented Design Principles and experience in testing JAVA based applications on multiple platforms. </li><li>Use of test management and error management tools like Zephyr and JIRA.</li><li>Strong knowledge on CI tools like Jenkins to align with Dev-Ops Deployment process.</li><li>Experience with large-scale multi-tiered systems and service-oriented architecture.</li><li>Experience with third party cloud-based testing tools a plus.</li><li>Knowledge on scripting languages such as Python or Ruby a plus</li><li>A solid understanding of relational databases and SQL.</li><li>Extreme sense of responsibility, accountability and passion for technology, quality of work and desire to learn &amp; take ownership. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>It would be nice if you had:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Application software development using Java or other web-centric technologies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What it’s like to work with us:</strong><p><br></p>Intelsat is connecting the world and transforming the satellite landscape by reaching beyond the traditional satellite industry. We are defining new products that will open new, profitable markets. To help us reach this goal, you should be a bold thinker who will perform a key role in shaping Intelsat innovation for years to come.<p><br></p><ul><li>We emphasize personal and professional growth</li><li>Awesome benefits including DTO, medical, tuition reimbursement, and training</li><li>Flexible work arrangements including 3 days of working from office</li><li>Fun, diverse, and inclusive culture</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Us:</strong><p><br></p>We’re Intelsat Inflight, the inflight internet company. We believe the internet should do everything it does on the ground, in the sky. Our worldwide inflight Wi-Fi services have made internet and video entertainment a regular part of flying. We are a diverse and mission-minded group of professionals all working together in extraordinary harmony. We connect the aviation industry and air travellers with innovative technology and applications, and we do it all in a high-energy environment that welcomes the next challenge. Be prepared to join a performance-obsessed team that is passionate about bringing the internet to every device, every flight, everywhere.<p><br></p><strong>Other Job Info:</strong><p><br></p>These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees assigned to this job.<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>As the foundational architects of satellite technology, Intelsat applies our expertise to develop breakthrough solutions that advance and secure boundless applications for our customers and partners.<p><br></p>At Intelsat, we increase human potential by connecting people, communities, businesses, and governments. Our employees enjoy a casual and collaborative environment, where we celebrate professional excellence in pursuit of the corporate mission. We hire skilled professionals who work in various areas such as: satellite engineering, network operations, cloud architecture, accounting, sales, legal, and more. Browse our current job openings or create a professional profile to stay informed about opportunities that match your interests and expertise.<p><br></p>Intelsat is subject to regulation by certain U.S. Government national security agencies, which require that we collect and share certain Personally Identifiable Information (“PII”) with the U.S. Government to obtain permission to employ non-U.S. persons in certain roles. If selected for a role at Intelsat, we may collect and share your PII for these purposes.<p><br></p><em> Intelsat is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer including Vets and Disabled</em>

title: C++ Software Engineer - Trading Systems
description: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area.<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. </li><li>Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications. </li><li>Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. </li><li>Participates actively in the design, architecture and create phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. </li><li>Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. </li><li>Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. </li><li>Strengthens productive internal/external working relationships. </li><li>Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with higher ups on unusual or complex matters</li><li>Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. </li><li>Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. </li><li>Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. </li><li>Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi complex information related to assigned activities. </li><li>Acts as individual contributor as well as team member. </li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. </li><li>Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. </li><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Walgreens And WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or similar field and at least 2 years of professional experience in Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field</li><li>Experience with Full stack Engineering</li><li>Experience writing code for applications or automation. </li><li>Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, APIs or mobile applications. </li><li>Experience building, testing applications or automation. </li><li>Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. </li><li>Experience creating coding solutions to fix moderate problems/issues. </li><li>Willing to travel up to/at least 5% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Experience working in an Agile environment. </li><li>MERN stack development experience using ReactJS, Redux, NodeJS, ExpressJS, MongoDB and with expertise on JavaScript/TypeScript. </li><li>Experience in Restful web services using NodeJS ExpressJS</li><li>Experience in NoSQL databases, such as MySQL and MongoDB</li><li>At least 2 years of progressively complex related experience</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems.</li></ul>

title: Ventas, Senior Financial Analyst, Business FP&A - Application via WayUp
description: Aha! helps companies build lovable software. We provide the world's #1 product development tools — Aha! Roadmaps , Aha! Ideas , Aha! Create , and Aha! Develop — which are used by more than 700,000 builders. Product teams rely on our expertise, guided templates, and training programs via Aha! Academy to be their best. We are proud to be a very different type of high-growth SaaS company. The business is self-funded, profitable, and 100 percent remote. We are recognized as one of the best fully remote companies to work for, champion the Bootstrap Movement , and have given over $1M to people in need through Aha! Cares . Learn more at www.aha.io .<p><br></p><strong>Our team</strong><p><br></p>Aha! engineering is a mid-sized, fully remote team that is highly productive. We are centered around North American time zones so we can collaborate during the workday.<p><br></p><ul><li>We help each other grow: We each bring unique skills to the table and want our teammates to feel valued from the start. Our onboarding program exposes new hires to the codebase and lets them contribute right away. </li><li>We move quickly: We ship code multiple times a day. We believe in getting valuable features in front of customers and iteratively improving as we learn what works and what does not. </li><li>We value product over process: We want the team to have the time and focus on solving complex challenges. We minimize the overhead by setting clear goals and avoiding heavyweight processes and excessive meetings.</li><li>We share knowledge freely: We share our learnings with each other and with the developer community. Our engineering blog demonstrates how we tackle interesting challenges at Aha! </li><li>We enjoy: We like what we do. And we want you to love your team and your job too. Learn more about The Responsive Method , our company values , and the generous benefits we offer.</li></ul><strong>Our technology</strong><p><br></p>Our web application is a single-instance, multi-tenant Ruby on Rails monolith supported by Postgres (database), Redis (background jobs), and memcached (Rails caching). We also run a Node.js webserver to support collaborative editing and real-time updates. Our application is hosted on Amazon Web Services and architected with ECS for reproducibility and scalability.<p><br></p>We utilize a growing amount of React on the front end to build rich client-side experiences, including our fully collaborative text editor and our slide presentation editor. We balance the strengths of both technologies — Rails for its conventions and simplicity and React for more powerful interactive functionality.<p><br></p>We embrace new technologies that help us deliver a lovable product, but we also remain cognizant of the maintenance overhead that a new library or platform brings. We solve the problems in front of us rather than prematurely optimizing to address issues that may never materialize.<p><br></p>We do most of our planning and collaboration in Aha! Roadmaps and built Aha! Develop so that software engineers and their teams could take advantage of those same rich features. We use Slack and Zoom for video calls. (Email? Rarely.)<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Most of our features involve writing significant Ruby on Rails code, so you should have experience working in a Rails codebase. We also write a lot of React but we are happy to help you learn that part on the job.<p><br></p><strong><u>You Also Have The Below Experience And Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>We believe that being a kind person who elevates the rest of the team is just as valuable as writing great code. You have strong problem-solving skills and experience working on important functionality for a cloud-based product. You are humble, eager to learn, and always willing to help others. You want teammates who enjoy solving problems regardless of the technologies and techniques involved. You have worked at meaningful scale before and want to do so again.<p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of experience working in Ruby on Rails</li><li>Experience producing scalable, efficient, and maintainable code</li><li>Experience building features (ideally at a high-growth SaaS company)</li><li>Active collaborator with product teams</li></ul><strong>Your work at Aha!</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>As a Ruby On Rails Engineer, Your Work Will Include</u></strong><p><br></p>We work on a broad range of features across the full stack.<p><br></p><ul><li>Implementing new features for our users, touching each layer of the MVC as needed</li><li>Building deeply interactive reporting interfaces using React</li><li>Working proactively with product and UX to refine and iterate on specifications as the feature takes shape</li><li>Investigating slow performance and optimizing queries to ensure Aha! is snappy and satisfying to use</li><li>Interfacing directly with users to quickly squash bugs as part of our regular customer support rotation </li><li>Documenting components in our style guide to help drive consistency</li></ul><p><br></p>If this role sounds appealing, we would love to hear from you. (A real human reviews every application.)<p><br></p><strong>Grow with us</strong><p><br></p>Everyone deserves to reach their fullest potential. We know that when we do work that matters with people we care about in a high-growth environment, we feel engaged and alive. And our goal is to help you do just that. We offer all the benefits you would expect and more, including profit sharing. The specific benefits listed below are reflective of what we offer U.S.-based hires. We also do our best to extend identical benefits to international teammates.<p><br></p><ul><li>The base salary range for this role in the US is between $100,000 and $160,000</li><li>Cash-based compensation also includes profit sharing and we contribute a percentage of your total pay each month towards your retirement</li><li>Medical, dental, and vision plans — for many teammates, we cover 100 percent of the premiums</li><li>Up to 200 hours of paid time off a year to spend however you want</li><li>30 to 90 days of paid parental leave and five to 10 days of paid care and bereavement leave</li><li>Up to $1,000 annually for third-party education, along with paid time off to immerse yourself in learning</li><li>Volunteer opportunities throughout the year</li></ul><p><br></p>Base salary and total compensation are dependent upon many factors, such as: skills, experience, and relevant past roles

description: <strong>Title: </strong>C#.Net Developer with RabbitMQ<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong>Oakbrook OR Chicago (Downtown)<p><br></p><strong>Overview:</strong><p><br></p>Sterling has helped build careers for thousands for professionals like yourself. Our expert recruiters support you at every step in the process and as a Best of Staffing company, Sterling provides exciting work with exceptional employers across the U.S.<p><br></p><strong>Hire Type:</strong> Direct Hire<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>I am looking for a Backend developer. This is one of smart home (IoT) initiative and to accomplish this the Software Engineer will work with other developers as well as other functions such as Engineering, Product Ownership, Marketing, Quality Assurance, Operations, and Customer Service in order to understand and translate product requirements into technical requirements, verify development matches product owner expectations, as well as maintain a high quality code base.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or engineering related field (An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of job related experience)</li><li>4 years of job-related experience</li><li>Experience with Microsoft technology stack, including .NET Core, C#, SQL, Azure</li><li>Experience with Visual studio, GIT</li><li>Experience in creating technical documentation</li><li>Experience estimating work</li><li>Experience with Agile methodologies and Scrum is required</li><li>Experience in creating technical documentation is required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Thorough understanding of OOP, SOLID, and RESTful services</li><li>Basic understanding of dependency injection and Azure cloud development</li><li>Understanding of MQTT &amp; AMQP, experience with RabbiMQ</li><li>Understanding of CI/CD (continuous integration/continuous delivery) tools, frameworks and deployment processes</li><li>Experience supporting project plan creation, and reporting progress to functional management at a project level</li><li>Good communication skills and the ability to work cross functionally with front end and quality engineers</li><li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Ability to debug, troubleshoot, and self-diagnose issues in software development</li><li>Ability to interface with scrum team, product owners, and scrum masters for ticket/issue management</li><li>Ability to travel up to 10% of the time domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information. </em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em>#SP</em></strong>
